loans.name: Roxana Yanira

texts.es: Roxana Yanira de treinta y seis años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida Eduardo y su hijo en casa propia; ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, las personas la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes; Roxana es una mujer dedicada a su labor, enérgica y con muchas metas por delante, su mas grande secreto para alcanzar el éxito es la constancia y el amor al trabajo sabe que solo así logrará lo que desea, como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. Roxana Yanira tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Roxana Yanira is 36 years old and lives with her husband Eduardo and their son in their own home.  She owns a store in which she sells food such as beans, milk, eggs, bread, and other necessary items.  She has owned this business for many years and has gained great sales experience that has helped increase her income.  The store is located in her home in a very central part of town.  She has many regular customers that prefer to shop in her store because she always has the products they need at affordable prices, and she provides excellent service.

Roxana is very dedicated to her work, she is energetic, and she has many goals for the future.  Her secret of success is consistency and a love of the work.  With these two things, she believes that anyone can achieve what they desire.

As any good business owner, she wants to grow her business.  However, she needs capital in order to do so.  Therefore, she is seeking a loan from INTEGRAL so that she can invest in the purchase of more basic grains, candies, eggs, bread, beverages, etc.  Roxana Yanira has great references and she is sure that she can repay the loan.  By growing her business, she is confident that she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase grains, candies, eggs, bread, and beverages.

loans.name: Bayarjargal

texts.en:
Bayarjargal is a 41-year-old married man who lives with his two daughters, son, and wife in an outer ger district that lacks the basic infrastructure of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia.  He is a teacher at a driving school.  

He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a car, which he plans to use for a transportation business in addition to his current job. His long term dream is to create a comfortable life for his family.

loans.use: to operate a transportation business.

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en:
Moustafa is from Iraq. He is a youth client, aged 18-years-old and is single. Moustafa lives with 6 family members, of whom two are employed.
Moustafa owns a small shop selling mobiles. He established this business in 2012 and has an employee. He has built good experience in this field and is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation. He is requesting a youth loan of $3,000 to pay the annual rental of his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 44 years old. She is not married and is blessed with three children.She runs a retail shop in the town of Tala. She has been in this business for the last six years and gets an income of KES.19,000 per month. She has a very good credit history with  KADET LTD. She is applying for her seventh loan of KES.100,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans to buy more stock for sale like maize flour, sugar, bread and detergent. She will use the extra profit to educate her children. She hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy stock like maize flour, sugar, bread and detergent.

loans.name: Salmah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Salmah Group. It consists of four ladies who live in Hodeida, Yemen.
Hafithah, 22, is the mother of three children. She lives with her family in Hodeida, Yemen. She became the main source of her family's income when her husband became unable to take care of the family due to his illness. She has been selling perfume, incense, and clothes for two years now. 
To help her continue with her business operations, she has applied for a youth loan of 20,000 YER. She will use her portion of the group's loan to buy more perfume, incense, clothes, and other materials for her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

loans.use: to buy more perfume, incense, clothes, and other materials for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Marta Elizabeth

texts.es: Marta Elizabeth vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad frijoles, arroz, pan, leche, huevos, azúcar, jabones entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le  permite obtener siempre las mejores ganancias, es muy conocida en la localidad la gente la recomienda porque su tienda es muy surtida siempre tiene lo que la gente necesita a precios accesibles, con producto de calidad y un servicio excelente; Marta  es una mujer dedicada a su labor, enérgica, y muy motivada a salir adelante, le gusta luchar por sus sueños sabe que si se esfuerza al máximo lograra lo que se propone y tendrá mucho éxito en su vida. Como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, pan, producto instantáneo, bebidas, jabones, etc. Marta Elizabeth tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, tiene la certeza que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía en que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Marta Elizabeth lives with her life partner and their children in her own house.  She has a store where she sells basic needs items like beans, rice, bread, milk, eggs, sugar, and soaps, among others.  She has had this business for several years.  It has gifted her with a lot of sales experience that allows her to always earn the best profits.

She is very well-known in the area.  People recommend her because her store is always well-stocked.  The store has what people need at affordable prices, quality products, and excellent service.

Marta is a woman who is devoted to her work, energetic, and very motivated to get ahead.  She likes to work hard to achieve her dreams.  She knows that if she puts forth maximum effort, she will achieve what she sets out to do, and she will be very successful in her life.

Like all good merchants, she wants to increase her business and make a new investment.  That is why she is requesting a loan from Integral.  She will use the loan to buy basic grains, candy, bread, instant products, drinks, and soaps, etc.

Marta Elizabeth has good payment references and a high moral character.  She is certain that she will be able to repay the loan.  She is also confident that she will bring financial security to her household.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, candy, bread, instant products, drinks, and soaps.

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
Wissam is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married, and has two children. Wissam provides the family's only income.

Wissam owns a small shop where he sells all the required materials for dyeing cars. He established his business in 2005, and now he has an employee. He built up experience in this field, and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Wissam is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to install a rolling shutter for his shop. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to install a rolling shutter for his shop.

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat, pictured here holding the group's passbook, is a 42-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband and seven children in Punjab, Pakistan. 

Since 2007, her husband has had a general store, and he works very hard to meet his family's needs. He needs additional capital for the growth of his business. His wife Nusrat is a member of a five-person lending group, and she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With the loan money, her husband can buy a variety of goods, like biscuits, sugar, rice, and chips, for his general store. This will help him meet his clients' needs and increase his savings to better his children's future.

Nusrat and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family. She is very much thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods for her husband's general store

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca cincuenta y ocho años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas de arroz y maíz, tiene varios años de experiencia en el negocio y eso le ha dado la oportunidad de obtener siempre las mejores ganancias, la pupusería esta ubicada en un lugar que califico como bueno para su trabajo ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque vende las pupusas mas ricas y calientitas de la zona además tiene los mejores precios, y el servicio mas rápido; Francisca es una mujer entregada a su labor, dispuesta a dar todo de su parte para cumplir sus sueños, su mas grande secreto es la perseverancia sabe que así alcanzara el éxito, en los últimos meses aumento la demanda y necesita invertir pero no posee de suficiente capital  por eso le solicita a INTGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar  maíz, frijol, chicharrón, queso, verduras, bebidas etc. .  Francisca tiene buenas referencias de pago y se hace responsable de cancelar la deuda y  a la vez tiene fe que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Francisca is a 58-year old woman who lives with her life partner and children. She works selling "pupusas" (stuffed tortillas) made of rice and corn, and has several years of experience in the business, which has given her the opportunity to always obtain the highest profit. Her store or "pupusería" is well located and counts with many clients. People choose it over others because it sells the most delicious and warmest pupusas in the area, and offers the best price and fastest service. Francisca is very dedicated to her job, and is willing to give everything in her power to reach her dreams. Her biggest secret is her determination, which she knows will help her to be successful. 

Over the last few months, the demand has increased and she needs to make an additional investment. She doesn't have enough capital to invest, which is why she's requesting a loan to INTEGRAL to buy corn, beans, pork rinds, cheese, vegetables, beverages, etc. Francisco has good payment references and has committed to repay the loan. She also has faith she'll be able to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, pork rinds, cheese, vegetables and beverages.

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher is from Iraq. He is 43 years old, married, and the father of three children, one of whom is employed.

Maher is a mechanic. He specializes in repairing cars and also in selling spare parts. He established his business in 1995, and now he has an employee. He built up experience in this field, and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Maher is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD to pay the yearly rent for his shop. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to pay the yearly rent for his shop.

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.es: Benedicto de sesenta años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida en casa propia, él es un empleado de ordenanza en una institución tiene varios años con el trabajo y ha adquirido valiosa experiencia que le permite realizar su labor de una forma excelente y al mismo tiempo obtener su paga satisfactoriamente, es muy conocido en la localidad donde reside pues Benedicto se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad y por la capacidad de estar siempre al servicio de los demás;  es un hombre realmente entregado a su labor, dispuesto a dar todo de su parte para cumplir sus objetivos, lo mas impórtate en su vida es su pequeña familia y en las ultimas semanas el deterioro de su vivienda ha incomodado la tranquilidad del hogar, la casa necesita reparaciones y quiere realizarlas lo mas pronto posible para la seguridad de todos, su mas grande secreto es la constancia, sabe que así alcanzara el éxito, necesita invertir pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ladrillos, tejas, cemento, polines  etc. Benedicto tiene buenas referencias de pago y se hace responsable de cancelar la deuda, a la vez tiene confianza que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Benedicto is 60 years old and lives with his wife in their own home.  He works as an orderly in an institution and has done this work for many years.  He has gained valuable experience that has enabled him to both enjoy his work and also receive satisfactory pay.  He is well known in the town in which he resides.  He is characterized by his kindness and by his willingness to always be at the service of others.  He is devoted to his work and he gives his all to reach his goals.  The most important thing in his life is his small family and in the recent weeks, the deterioration of his home has disrupted the harmony in the household.

His home needs repairs and he wants to complete those repairs as quickly as possible for the safety of everyone.  He needs to invest in supplies for the repairs but does not have sufficient capital.  Therefore, he is seeking a loan from INTEGRAL so that he can buy bricks, tiling, cement, rafters, etc.  Benedicto has great references, he is very responsible, and he promises to repay the loan.  This will help him provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bricks, tiling, cement, and rafters.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 41 years old and married with four children. All of her children are in school, and she is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Shirley has had a shell crafting business in the Philippines for 13 years. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy nylon, string, and shells. 

In the future, Shirley would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy nylon, string, and shell.

loans.name: Charakhan

texts.en:
Charakhan is a 31-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and the mother of two children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Charakhan is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Charakhan has four years of experience in the home-based sewing business, making custom-ordered dresses and other small fabric household items. She is currently using an old sewing machine, which she would like to replace with a newer model to improve her speed and meet the orders of more customers. She would also like to make some small changes to her work area by painting it and adding some small furniture items to store her materials. 

To make these purchases, she is taking a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of 2,500 USD.

Because of the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for her protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to replace her old sewing machine and make her work area nicer.

loans.name: Verah

texts.en:
Verah is a 27-year-old farmer in Kisii county, in Kenya, where she lives with her husband and two children, both of whom are schooling. She has been in farming for the past seven years, producing milk, eggs, beans, maize, bananas, and potatoes, which she sells at the local market in her area. 

She is requesting a KES 31,200 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow that will give her more milk produce, that will, in turn, generate extra income, that will help her improve her living standards and pay for her children's schooling. She aspires to have five dairy cows in the next five years.

Poor road networks, pests, and diseases are her major challenges in farming. Verah appreciates the way Juhudi Kilimo is fast in processing loans.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Bena

texts.en:
Bena is 39 years old, and lives in the town of Mubende in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Bena has been working hard to manage her restaurant. 

To help expand her business, Bena has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more raw and dry food such as bananas, beans, and maize flour.  This should help Bena generate greater profits, and pay school fees for her children and some of her relatives. 

Bena hopes that in the future, she will be able to start constructing a residential house. 

Bena is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Bena, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more commodities for her restaurant.

loans.name: Pierre

texts.en:
Pierre is 28 years old. He is married with one child. His wife is unemployed.

He has been in business for three years as a retail businessman, selling different items such as rice, sugar, and milk.  He has decided to get the loan to add more items in his retail store; with the profit, he will pay school fees for his wife.

loans.use: To buy more rice and milk to sell, in order to pay school fees for his wife.

loans.name: Tadamon Group

texts.en:
Hafidah is a 45-year-old mother who lives with her husband and 4 kids in Hodeida, Yemen. She is the leader of Tadamon Group. 

She has sold perfume, incense, clothes and makeup for the last four years, trying to help her husband with the family's daily expenses.

She and her group have applied for a loan of 140,000 YER. With her portion, she will buy more quantities of perfume, incense, clothes and makeup. She hopes that this will boost her income.

She expects that one day she will be able to make her own incense

loans.use: to buy more quantities of perfume, incense, clothes and makeup for her business.

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en: Mrs. Bayarmaa is a 44-year-old widow who lives with her two sons, both of whom are students.  She works as a conductor for the local public transportation company. The family lives in a small house in an outer district of her city which lacks basic infrastructure. Her younger brother became engaged last autumn and has been living with his fiancee since last summer. Bayarmaa’s sister-in-law is student too, and she is requesting a 800,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to pay her sister-in-law’s tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay her sister-in-law's tuition fees.

loans.name: Josiane

texts.en: Josiane is 34 years old. She is a widow with two children, the older of whom is 11 while the younger is 9. She has been in business for five years and is requesting this loan to buy more beans, ground nuts (or peanuts) and rice to sell to her customers. She will use the money she earns from this loan to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy more beans, peanuts and rice to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Carlos Ovidio

texts.es: Carlos, vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos menores de edad que se dedican a trabajar, la esposa de Carlos se dedica a vender frutas y verduras de forma ambulante y Carlos se dedica a trabajar en su propia carpintería, ambos son muy trabajadores y responsables. Carlos elabora diferentes artículos elaborados de madera como: roperos, muebles, mesas, sillas y otros más, realizando alguno por pedidos previos hechos por sus clientes y elaborando otros para vender en su negocio, lo que le deja ganancias extras de mucho beneficio. Carlos solicita un préstamo y de esta forma dar un paso más en su negocio, contando con más materia prima para elaborar su trabajo de manera que pueda aceptar más pedidos y así mismo elaborar más muebles para comercializar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Carlos lives with his wife and two minor children. They both work: Carlos' wife is a street vendor selling fruit and vegetables, and Carlos has his own carpentry shop. They are both very hardworking and responsible. Carlos makes different items out of wood, such as closets, tables, chairs, and other funiture. Some of them he makes to fulfill a particular order from a customer, and others to sell at his shop, which brings in extra earnings and a high profit.

Carlos is requesting a loan so that he can move his business another step forward, by obtaining more raw material to do his work. This will allow him to accept more orders and also make more furniture to sell at his shop.

loans.use: to purchase wood and complete more carpentry work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en: Eugene is 24 years old and single. He has been in the business of selling shirts and pants for the last six years. He is requesting this loan to buy more of these items to sell to his customers. Eugene plans to use the additional income he earns to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy more shirts and pants to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
As a married mother of ten children, Charles works hard to support her family.

She has a business making and selling peanuts (salted and sugar coated) in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig-fattening. Charles is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her peanuts.

Charles has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her peanuts.

loans.name: Shaheen's Group

texts.en:
Shaheen (shown holding a passbook) is the principal of a school that she founded a few years ago. She is an active and hard-working woman and lives in Rawalpindi with her husband and their son, who attends nursery school. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She will use her loan funds to invest in buying furniture, books, and stationery for her school. Her goal is to expand her school through this financing. She dreams of seeing her school succeed.

Shaheen is hopeful that the loan will be a productive investment for her and that it will bring positive changes in the life of her family.

loans.use: To purchase furniture, books and other stationery for her school.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dressed chicken to offer for sale

loans.name: Louise

texts.en:
Louise, age 32, sells fruit to earn an income. She and her husband have a two-year-old child and a one-year-old baby. Her husband is a store owner. 

Louise has requested this loan in order to buy more fruit to offer for sale. 

She intends to use her profits to grow her savings.

loans.use: to buy fruit to offer for sale

loans.name: Karim

texts.en:
Karim, age 49, breeds cattle and sells them directly from his home to local butchers for meat purposes. He has more than 10 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father who taught him well how to look after cattle. He is also a taxi driver, but orders for this service are very rare. Karim and his wife have two children.
 
Karim usually buys calves, raises and fattens them over a period of five to six months, and resells them for a more profitable price at the local livestock bazaar. This activity brings him 300 AZN income per month. The local people use beef in many everyday national dishes, such as as pilau and dolma, always served with yogurt sauce. Karim's son helps him in his work and is learning how to look after the livestock. 

This business provides the main financial income in his family, but at present it is not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Karim has therefore applied for a loan in the amount of 1,500 AZN in order to purchase four cattle. This will be his second loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy four cattle

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer, age 38, buys and sells household products in Kapsabet to earn an income. Her business has been in operation for a period of three years, earning her a monthly income of KES 15,000. Jeniffer and her husband have two children, ages five and 11 years old.

She is servicing her fourth loan in the amount of KES 100,000 from KADET Ltd after successfully repaying her previous one. She intends to use her new loan funds to purchase more household goods to offer for sale. 

Jeniffer intends to use her profits to open a salon business. She hopes to prosper in both of her businesses.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of  household goods to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products from Avon to offer for sale

loans.name: Karen Maria

texts.es: Karen, es una persona que anhela mucho salir adelante y mejorar día con día en la vida,  vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos. Karen  posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos y de primera necesidad para el hogar. Este negocio es el cual le ha permitido poder contar con ganancias extras lo que le brinda la ayuda necesaria tanto a su esposo como a ella para pagar su casa y recibos a tiempo, y así mismo contar con los alimentos y todo lo necesario para vivir dignamente. Es por esto que Karen desea contar con más productos en la tienda, razón por la cual solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL,  a través del cual pueda comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, lácteos, bebidas y otros más los cuales son necesarios en una buena tienda. Esto es muy importante para Karen ya que cuenta con mucha competencia en el lugar, es por esto que debe contar con todo lo necesario para satisfacer a sus clientes y así ganar otros más los cuales prefieran comprar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Karen is an individual who truly wants to succeed and improve her life day after day. She lives with her husband and two children.

Karen owns a shop, in which she sells perishable goods and basic household foodstuffs. This business has provided her with extra earnings, giving her and her husband the help they so need to pay for their house and bills on time, as well as the food and other items needed to live with dignity. 

Because of this Karen wants to stock more products in the shop, which is why she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL. Through this loan she can buy rice, beans, sugar, dairy products, drinks and other goods which are essential in any good shop. This is very important to Karen since there is a lot of competition nearby. As a result, she must do everything she can to satisfy her customers and attract others who prefer to buy from her shop.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, cheese and other products to stock her shop.

loans.name: Farayil

texts.en:
Farayil, age 52, breeds livestock to earn a living. He learned this business at a very young age from his father, who had much experience and taught him well. During those years, Farayil acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business.

He purchases calves in the central livestock market and raises them. After fattening the animals, he resells them for a profitable price at the livestock bazaar. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and is used in many local everyday dishes, such as pilau and dolma.  

Farayil's business requires a lot of physical strength, as he spends most of his time in the open air. He and his wife have three children, and his son helps him to feed the animals.

His monthly income is 300 AZN and Farayil wishes to increase it. As meat is in high demand, he needs more capital to put toward his business and to cover the market. For this purpose, he has applied for a loan in the amount of 2,000 AZN. He will use the loan to buy one cow, two cattle, and five sheep.

loans.use: to buy one cow, two cattle, and five sheep

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 35 years old, married and supports three of her children, aged 15, 13, and 5 years old.  She is a farmer in Kapsabet and has been in operation for a period of six years. She earns a monthly income of KES 20,000.

Eunice is servicing her third loan of KES 100,000 from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to purchase fertilizers, maize seeds and potato seeds.  

The profits Eunice earns will be used to educate her school-going children and to plough back into her farm.  

She hopes to own a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers, maize seeds and potato seeds.

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en:
Clarisse is 21 years old. She is married with a 2-year-old child. Her husband is also a businessman. 

The loan will be used to buy more pants and sweaters to sell. The profit will assist Clarisse in expanding the business.

loans.use: to buy more sweaters and pants for sale.

loans.name: Rafayel

texts.en:
Rafayel is 54 years old, married and has three children. He has been breeding cattle and sheep for the last 10 years. During these years he gained necessary skills and knowledge for effective management of his business. 
He usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for five to six months and then resells them for a profit at the livestock bazaar. His monthly income is 250 AZN and this business is the only source of income for his family. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. He also sells fur because local people make blankets from it.

Now Rafayel would like to buy more animals and for this purpose he applied for a loan of 1500 AZN. He will buy two cattle and six sheep. This will be his second loan with AqroInvest and he has a positive client history.

loans.use: to buy two cattle and six sheep.

loans.name: Rauf

texts.en:
Rauf, age 34, has been raising livestock for the past seven years. He usually buys calves, raises and fattens them, and sells them at a profitable price.  Selling meat is a worthwhile business because meat is an essential staple among the local people, who use it in many everyday dishes like dolma and pilov.
 
Rauf is a very kind and friendly young man who is unmarried and living with his parents. His monthly income is 350 AZN, which represents the sole financial income for the family. He reports that it is very difficult to cover the needs of the family with such a small income. Looking after the animals is also difficult, requiring that he spend most of his time outside. The economic climate in the region is one of austerity, but Rauf is a very positive man and his father supports and helps him a great deal.

Rauf has applied for a loan in the amount of 2,000 AZN, with which he will buy two milk cows and three calves. This will be his second loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy two milk cows and three calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is a rice farmer in Solana. To earn his living, he plants and harvests rice, which he sells to traders. He usually gains approximately PhP 15,000 per harvest twice a year. The profits go toward the family expenses and serve as revolving capital for the business. Frank and his wife have one child.

Frank would like to improve his crop production, which is why he is now requesting additional capital in the amount of PhP 15,000. He will use his loan funds to invest in buying farm inputs (fertilizers and insecticides) for use on his farm.
 
He is hopeful that eventually, with good crop production and income, he will be able to create a savings fund for the family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages, to resell in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy blankets for blanket-selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Madona

texts.en:
Madona is 22 years old. She lives in the Akhaltsikhe District with her husband and an infant son. Madona had requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected because of low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from her husband’s job as a distributor at a private company. He makes 750 Laris per month, hardly enough to feed a three-member family. According to Credo estimates, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Madona has requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of new joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to low income. With the received credit, Madona will purchase clothing from wholesalers and will resell at higher prices. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine, age 41, runs a charcoal sales business. She lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda with her husband and five children. Two of the children are currently enrolled in school. Christine has been running her business for the past five years.
 
To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal to offer for sale, which will in turn help Christine to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Christine hopes to become a powerful local entrepreneur in the future. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Christine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to offer for sale

loans.name: Alkhalil Group

texts.en:
Alkhalil Group is made up of five ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. The group leader, Mriam, is 40 years old and lives with her husband and seven children in Taiz -Yemen.  

Mriam wants to start her project of raising and selling sheep and sheep products. She has wide experience on sheep raising and breeding. She knows it's a profitable business, but due to her little resources and money shortage, she has never been able to have her own sheep.

When Mriam heard about AMB, she mentioned that her dream seems to be very close. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 YER to cover some of the costs of purchasing and raising sheep.

loans.use: to cover some of the costs of purchasing and raising sheep.

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en:
Rosette, age 47, and her husband operate a bar business. They have operated this venture for the past five years. They have raised four children: the eldest is now 25 years old and the youngest is 16. 

Rosette is requesting a loan in order to add a greater selection and quantity of drinks to the bar. 

She intends to re-invest the expected profits into expanding the business.

loans.use: to add a greater selection and quantity of drinks to the bar

loans.name: Eileen

texts.en:
Eileen, age 30, is a farmer in Kisii, Kenya, where she lives her husband and four children. The children are all enrolled in school. Eileen has been involved in farming for the past five years. The farm produces vegetables and milk, which she sells at the local market in her area. She reports that pests and diseases are her major challenges in farming. She also runs a cereals shop as an additional source of income.

Eileen is requesting a loan in the amount of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo. She will use the loan funds to buy and insure a dairy cow. This addition will provide her with more milk, which will in turn generate more income. This will help her uplift her family's livelihood and pay for her children's schooling. 

Eileen's goals over the next five years are to have four dairy cows and to expand her cereals shop.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Ada Beatriz

texts.es: Ada de 30 años de edad, es una joven muy responsable, vive junto a su hija de seis años de edad y junto a una hermana menor. Ada es una persona muy trabajadora, quien ha tenido que ser padre y madre para poder sacar adelante a su hija, contando con la bendición que su padre le heredó antes de morir una casa para ella y su hermana. Ada  posee una tienda de productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, así mismo se dedica a la elaboración de almuerzos que comercializa con empleados de la fábrica que elabora azúcar, por lo que es un negocio bastante estable que cuenta con varios clientes fijos. Con todo el deseo de salir adelante y poder contar con una vida mejor, Ada  solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir su tienda y así mismo invertir en la compra de materia prima como arroz, carnes, verduras y otros más para realizar más almuerzos.
texts.en:
Ada, 30 years old, is a very responsible young woman. She lives with her six-year-old daughter and a younger sister. She is a very hardworking person who has had to be both father and mother to her daughter. In supporting her daughter she is blessed that her father left her and her sister a house before he died.

Ada has a store selling basic supplies and perishable products. She also makes lunches, which she sells to workers at a sugar factory.  Consequently she has a stable business with several steady customers.

With a great desire to get ahead and achieve a better life, Ada is requesting a loan in order to stock her store and also to buy ingredients, such as rice, meat, vegetables and other items, in order to prepare more lunches.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make lunches.

loans.name: Miraluna

texts.en: Miraluna is 45 years old and a widow. She is from Tipolo, Plaridel. She has three grown children who have helped her in taking care of their bananas. They have been raising bananas for five years and earn 6,000 PHP a month. In 2011, Miraluna joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and pay for weeding costs. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for weeding costs

loans.name: Yakelin

texts.es:
Yakelin  es casada y tiene una hija que esta en etapa escolar, vive en una casa alquilada, ocupando tres habitaciones, la casa se encuentra ubicada  en la zona central de la ciudad de La Paz.
Yakelin trabaja por más de diez horas al día vendiendo ropa y accesorios de vestir de forma ambulante, ya que no cuenta con un puesto fijo, y con lo poco que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alquiler, alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para aumentar su mercadería y comprar más ropa ya que desea mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Yakelin, es tener su casa propia para dar más comodidad y seguridad a su familia, también desea tener su propia tienda para ya no hacerlo de forma ambulante.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Yakelin’s married and has a school age daughter.  She lives in a rented, three-bedroom house located in the central part of La Paz.  Yakelin works more than ten hours daily selling clothes and clothing accessories from place to place since she does not have a permanent stand and with the little she earns is able to cover rent, food and basic utility costs for her family.  She needs the loan to increase her stock merchandise and to buy more clothes because she wants to improve her income and her quality of life.

Yakelin’s dream is to own a house to provide more comfort and security for her family and she also wants to have a store so she doesn’t have to sell from place to place any longer.  This is her second loan request to IMPRO and first with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetable to resell.

loans.name: Ahmedi

texts.en:
Ahmedi is 30 years old and lives in the town of Mityana, in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, two of them currently in school. For the past seven years, Ahmedi has been working hard to manage his small business, where he sells second-hand shoes. 

To help expand his business, Ahmedi has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. He will use the loan funds to buy the best quality second-hand shoes, which will attract more customers. This use of the loan will help him to generate greater profits, to pay school fees for his children, and to have a better life. He hopes that, in the future, he will be able to open up a big wholesale shop. 

Ahmedi is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ahmedi, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to buy the best quality second-hand shoes, in order to attract more customers and increase profits.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, age 34, runs a retail shop that sells such essential commodities as sugar, soap, milk, and bread. He has owned and operated this business for the past five years. He lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda with his wife and their four children, all of whom are currently enrolled in school. He works hard to support his family.

To help expand his business, John has requested a loan in the amount of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities to offer for sale in his shop. This will help John to generate greater profits and pay his children's school fees. 

In the future, John would like to be able to afford to construct rental houses. 

John is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like John who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar, and soap to offer for sale

loans.name: Aloys

texts.en:
Aloys, age 40, sells clothing to earn a living. He has been engaged in this venture for the past 11 years. His wife helps him in the business. They have three children between the ages of 10 and 14 years old.

Aloys is requesting a loan in order to buy more sweaters and skirts to offer for sale. With the expected profits, he intends to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy more sweaters and skirts for sale.

loans.name: Framelyn

texts.en:
Framelyn is 41 years old and manages a general store. She is thankful because she has been earning PHP 150 to 200 each day, which is used for their daily necessities. 

To make her source of income more beneficial, Framelyn is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase canned goods, biscuits, noodles, salt and cooking oil. Hopefully, the loan will be a great help in improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, biscuits, noodles, salt and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Ms Mumtaz, age 51, operates a milk sales business. She has been engaged in this venture for the past 25 years. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to help support her family, at a time when her husband was the only breadwinner. With the passage of time, her sales increased and so did her income. She now has four cows and one buffalo, and she sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter, cheese, and ghee, all of which she makes from the milk. 

She has built up a good client list and her business is thriving enough to allow her to lead a decent life. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home and in her community. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. She has been in association with Kashf for the past two years. She has also managed to set aside some savings.

Ms Mumtaz has applied for a loan in the amount of PKR 30,000 in order to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Ms Sughran, age 38, has been running a milk sales business for the past 10 years. She initiated her business by buying a buffalo to help support her family at a time when her husband was the only breadwinner. Ms Sughran and her husband have six children. With the passage of time, her sales increased and so did her income. She now has two buffaloes, seven cows, and four calves. This has all happened due to her courage and determination.  

Because of her work, she is respected in her home and her community. She helps her husband in all family concerns as well as financial matters. While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her son to college for further studies. She shared her dream of providing quality educations to all her children in order to ensure them a bright future. 

With her savings and a loan in the amount of PKR 30,000, Ms Sughran intends to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. She is in her second loan cycle and is very thankful to Kashf and to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo

loans.name: Qurishan

texts.en:
Ms. Qurishan is a 38-year-old married woman. She has been running a catering business with the support of her husband for the past 12 years. She cooks four to five dishes per day. Her husband assists her by delivering the dishes to customers. She is a well known cook in her town and earns enough to provide for her six children. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. She is in her fifth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan to buy rice with packs of oil, salt, and spices. It will help her to cater to the demands of her customers time after time. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, salt, and spices.

loans.name: Priscila Raquel

texts.es:
Priscila tiene 24 años de edad, esta casada. Se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos y le ayuda a su esposo con las labores agrícolas desde hace varios años. Ella se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. a preparar el desayuno, para luego dirigirse junto a su esposo a trabajar en su cultivo. Por la tarde su esposo se dirige a trabajar en la fontanería en un pozo de la comunidad hasta las 9:00 p.m. 

Ella compra los insumos agrícolas como el abono, semillas, veneno, etc. en una ciudad que esta a cuatro kilómetros caminando de su casa hasta el lugar en donde aborda un vehiculo que la traslade a la ciudad. El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar materiales para construir su casa. Debido a que en la que vive es de lámina, su deseo es construir su casa, instalarle la energía eléctrica y el agua potable.
texts.en:
Priscila is a 24-year-old married woman.  She takes care of the household chores and also has also helped her husband in his farm work for several years.  She wakes up every morning at 5:00 a.m. to make breakfast, then goes with her husband to the fields.  In the afternoon her husband works as a plumbing technician at a well in their community until 9:00 p.m.

She buys the farming supplies such as as fertilizer, seeds and insecticide in a city that is several kilometers from her house.  She walks four kilometers to the place where the bus picks her up and brings her to the city.

She is seeking a loan from Fundación Campo in order to buy materials to build her house.  Since she currently lives in a house constructed of laminated steel sheets, she wants to build her own house where she can have electricity and potable water.

loans.use: to buy materials to build her house.

loans.name: Kamila

texts.en:
Kamila is 32 years old and a married woman, very hard-working and experienced.  She breeds cows and cattle, sells dairy products, and sells cattle for beef to local butchers. Kamila has eight years of experience in this field, thanks to her father, who taught her the best ways to look after cattle. 

Kamila usually buys small cattle, raises and fattens them for five to six months, and then resells them for a profitable price in the local livestock bazaar.  Milk and yoghurt she sells to the neighbors. Dairy and meat-selling brings 300 AZN per month in income. 

Milk and yoghurt, as well as beef, are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes, such as pilau and dolma, and they always use yoghurt sauce. Milk products are considered to be very healthy, and are also consumed in everyday life.   

Kamila applied for a 2,000 AZN loan to purchase three cattle, two milking cows, and fodder. This will be her second loan, and she has a very positive loan history.

loans.use: to buy three beef cattle, two milking cows, and fodder.

loans.name: Rhealiza

texts.en:
Rhealiza is 25 years old and is married with three children. To generate income, she engaged herself in a hog-raising business. She usually earns about PHP 2,500 per piglet. She has been in her business for two years. 

Rhealiza wants to lift up her family from poor living. She wanted to have more hogs to raise, but she lacks the necessary capital. In this regard, she is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 30,000 to buy additional hogs to raise and also feed for them.  

She is hoping that very soon she can prove that she can provide a better living for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional hog to raise and also feed for them.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 42 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has four children, with three of them currently in school. For the past five years, Susan has been working hard to manage her school business, which has a nursery school and primary school. 

To help expand her business, Susan has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more furniture and uniforms for the school, and will help Susan to generate greater profits and pay for her family's medical expenses and school fees. Susan hopes that in the future she will be able to improve her family's standard of living more. 

Susan is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Susan who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more furniture and uniforms for the school,

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Mujeres Valientes, es un grupo conformado por tres mujeres de la comunidad de Pujili, mujeres emprendedoras, que buscan la manera de salir adelante y de ayudar económicamente a su familia y tratan de cumplir cada uno de sus sueños a base de trabajo y esfuerzo diario.
La presidenta de este grupo es la Sra. Omayra , ella tiene 22 años, tiene dos hijos pequeños a quien ama y lucha diariamente por sacarles adelante y darles todo lo que necesitan, Omayra se define como una persona humilde, llena de valores cristianos y muy trabajadora, son estas cualidades que han hecho de Omayra una mujer digna de admiración y de respeto de su familia y de toda su comunidad.
El crédito que Omayra solicito a FODEMI se lo va a invertir en la compra de dos vacas pequeñas, para crianza y la producción de leche en un tiempo, ya que Omayra se dedica a la crianza de ganado y quiere seguir incrementando su pequeño negocio de crianza de animales.
El sueño que Omayra tiene seguir trabajando en su negocio y seguir creciendo cada día más, y poderles dar a sus hijos una buena educación, y así mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Valientes” (Brave Women) communal bank is composed of three women from the community of Pujili.  They are enterprising women seeking ways to get ahead and help their families economically; each one tries to reach her dream by means of daily work and effort.

This group’s president is Omayra, 22.  She has two small children she loves and strives daily to move them forward and give them everything they need.  Omayra defines herself as a humble person filled with Christian values and very hardworking; these are the qualities that have made Omayra a woman who is worthy of admiration and respect from her family and her entire community.

The loan Omayra asked FODEMI for is to buy two young cows to raise and in time produce milk because Omayra works raising cattle and wants to increase her small business of raising animals.  Omayra’s dream is to continue working in her business and  continue to grow more every day and to be able to give her children a good education thus improving her entire family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy young dairy cows.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana de 41 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos menores de edad, quienes se dedican a estudiar. Para poder contar con una vida mejor Ana trabaja en su propio negocio elaborando almuerzos, pupusas, yuca frita y otros platillos típicos, su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación por lo que también se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. Ana solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda comprar harina, granos básicos, queso, verduras, especias, aderezos, platos desechables y otros productos más para elaborar mayor cantidad de alimentos y así mismo para contar con elementos necesario para vender sus productos. Ella es una  mujer muy alegre quien se esfuerza para brindarle la mejor ayuda a su esposo y de esta manera solventar todos los gastos de hogar y contar con una vida estable y más tranquila.
texts.en:
Ana, 41, lives with her husband and three minor children who attend school.  To have a better life, Ana works in her own business cooking lunches, ‘pupusas’ [filled, grilled corn cakes], fried manioc and other traditional dishes.  Her business is home-based so she also does the household chores.

Ana is asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy flour, basic grains, cheese, vegetables, spices, dressings, disposable plates and other products to make larger amounts of food and have the necessary items to sell her products.  She’s a very cheerful woman who strives to help her husband the best way possible to cover household expenses and have a more stable, stress-free life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare traditional dishes.

loans.name: Lawi

texts.en:
Lawi is 52 years old, married, and has five children. His spouse is a civil servant, and this contributes to the family's income. Lawi runs a dairy farming business, as well as hawking milk. He has been in business for the past four years, and his monthly income from the business is KES 20,000.
 
He has borrowed a second loan of KES 80,000 for a period of one year, after having successfully repaid his first loan. He intends to use the new loan to purchase animal feed and containers for storing and transporting milk. 

Lawi plans to use the additional income to plough back capital into the business. He will also save some, in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed, and containers for storing and transporting milk.

loans.name: Lubnan Group

texts.en: This group is called Lubnan and consists of four ladies who live in Yemen. Lubna, 40 years old, is the mother of three children. She lives with her family in Hodeida, Yemen. For five months, she has been selling perfumes, incense, and clothes (this type of work is called locally Dlalah). Lubna has applied for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB to buy more products and other materials for her business in order to expand her business. This expansion will help  her and her husband to improve their family's life. She and her group have applied for a loan worth 80,000 YER in total.

loans.use: to buy more products for resale

loans.name: De Confianza Los Cerritos Group

texts.es: El banco comunal de Confianza los Cerritos es conformado por 10 integrantes, todas mujeres de la comunidad de Malpaisillo con 15 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Estas mujeres son personas trabajadoras, responsables. Con ganas de superación para brindarles un mejor futuro a  sus hijos.  Juana Francisca es la coordinadora del banco y gracias a su espíritu de salir adelante ella tiene por actividad una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, se dedica a su negocio aproximadamente unas 12 horas diarias. Actividad que la realiza con muchos gustos ya que ha sido su forma de vida y de sus hijos. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos de consumo diario y en cantidades pequeñas como sobre de café, sobre de champo, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan. El objetivo de préstamos es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para brindar mejor servicios a sus clientes. Juana Francisca se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva , ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá  invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para brindar mejor servicios a sus clientes, comprando productos de consumo diario para la pulpería, y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos en un futuro no muy lejano. Y de dicha forma cumplir sus sueños de mantener su fuente de trabajo digna. El banco comunal agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan para tener fuentes de trabaja digno.
texts.en:
The Confianza los Cerritos communal bank is made up of 10 members, all of whom are women from the community of Malpaisillo with 15 children in their care. These women are hardworking and responsible people who have a desire to overcome in order to give their children a better future.

Juana Francisca is the bank's coordinator. Thanks to her spirit to succeed, she has a grocery store, or "pulpería," which is located in her house. She works for about 12 hours a day in her store. She is happy with her job because it provides a livelihood for her and her children. A pulpería is a small store which sells basic goods in small quantities, such as packets of coffee and shampoo, rice, beans, sugar, milk, and bread. 

Her goal is to use this loan to invest in working capital and stock her business to offer a better service to her clients. Juana Patricia is very grateful for the Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help she will be able to invest in her business and better serve her clients by buying basic goods for the store. She will then be able to increase her income in the not-so-distant future and fulfill her dream of maintaining a decent source of work.

The communal bank is grateful for the help which Kiva investors provide for them to have a decent livelihood.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her store with goods such as packets of coffee and shampoo, rice, beans, sugar, milk, and bread.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes for her clothes selling business

loans.name: Allison Joseph

texts.es: Allison Joseph 34 años de edad, soltera del municipio de Chinandega, Ella es una persona luchadora ella inicia este negocio por su mama y con el propósito de apoyar con los gastos de su hogar ella inicia por cuenta propia su propio negocio de  venta de mercadería en general, consisten en vender ropa de niños, adultos, pantalones, camisas, vestidos, short, faldas, ropa interior, venta de plata, oro, cosméticos entre otros ella todo lo realiza de forma ambulante y por encargo las ventas son por lo general al crédito a clientes fijos y eventuales. Allison ya tiene 10 años de poseer este negocio y poco a poco ha podido crecer porque su clientela ha incrementado. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para  invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con la compra de mercadería y satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes.-
texts.en: Allison Joseph, 34, is single and from Chinandega.  She’s a tenacious person who started her business thanks to her mother aiming at helping with household expenses.  She started on her own initiative to sell general merchandise consisting in children’s and adults’ clothing, pants, shirts, dresses, shorts, skirts, underwear, silver, gold and cosmetics, among others.  She does all this from place to place and to order.  She usually sells on credit to both regular and occasional customers.  Allison has had the business for 10 years now and she’s gradually been able to grow because her clientele has increased.  The financing she’s asking for is to invest in working capital and stock her business with the purchase of merchandise thus meeting customer needs.

loans.use: to buy silver, gold, children's and adult's clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Alie Kamara's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of the Kiva.org base in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone, in order to apply for a loan of 5,400,000.00 Leones for the entire team. With the help of this loan, they will be able to meet their immediate financial challenges and at the end of each month, they can repay the loan using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

Mohamed, age 29, is the leader of this group. He is a native of Yormandu in eastern Sierra Leone. Mohamed and his wife have two children, both of whom are attending primary school. Mohamed has served in the teaching profession for six years now and is pursuing further studies in college. He has requested this loan in order to pay his college fees.

loans.use: to pay his college fees

loans.name: Cecilia Yanira

texts.es: Cecilia de 34 años de edad, vive en casa propia en terreno familiar donde reside  junto a cuatro hijos menores de edad quienes dependen por completo de ella, a pesar que no está junto a su compañero de vida él le brinda una pequeña ayuda para sus hijos, por lo que Cecilia debe trabajar muy duro. Desde hace 3 años que ella vende platillos típicos en su casa de habitación y así mismo los vende de forma ambulante por distintas colonias incluso mercados, donde las ventas son muy buenas. Ella cuenta con referencias muy positivas ya que dicen que es muy responsable y dedicada a sus hijos. Cecilia solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para poder comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima para los platillos típicos como: elotes, azúcar, vegetales, así mismo vasos y platos desechables entre otros más. La estabilidad del negocio es importante para Cecilia ya que actualmente es la única fuente de ingresos que posee.
texts.en:
Cecilia, 34, lives in her own house on family property with her four minor children who are completely dependent on her.  Despite not being with her partner anymore, he nevertheless gives her a little help for their children but Cecilia must work very hard.  For the last three years she’s been selling traditional food from home and also from place to place in various neighborhoods and even in markets where sales are very good.  She has very positive references who say she’s very responsible and devoted to her children.

Cecilia is asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy larger amounts of raw materials like corn, sugar and vegetables for her dishes as well as glasses and disposable plates among others.  The business’ stability is important to Cecilia because it’s currently the only source of income she has.

loans.use: to buy corn, sugar and vegetables.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 49-year-old farmer in Kisii county, in Kenya, where she lives with her husband and two children, both of whom are schooling. She has been in farming for the past six years, producing bananas, potatoes, maize, milk, and beans, which she sells at the local market in her area.

Ruth is requesting a KES 62,400 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow which will produce more milk and generate more income that she will use to boost her livelihood and pay for her children's schooling. She aspires to have four dairy cows in the next five years.

Pests, diseases, and poor road networks are her major challenges in farming. Ruth is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for funding the loan.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Marlene Francisca

texts.es:
Marlene de 27, anos de edad, soltera sin hijos, y en sus ratos libre le gusta mucho escuchar música y leer libros, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar, trabajo social.
Gracias a su espíritu de emprendedora y sus ganas de salir adelante se dedica a  la venta de artículos plásticos, desde hace 14 años que trabaja en dicha actividad. Ella se dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diaria, actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto, y en la actualidad ha sido su forma de vida. en la foto se muestra a marlene con su negocio.
Marlene se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva , ya que gracias a la ayuda que le brindan podrá invertir en capital de trabajo para surtir su negocio, en la compra de artículos plásticos como panas, baldes, vasos plastos, productos descartables, contenedores de agua, barriles, picheles, termos. De esta manera podrá sostener su negocio e incrementar sus ingresos  en un futuro no muy lejano.
texts.en:
Marlene, age 27, is single and has no children. In her free time she greatly enjoys listening to music and reading books. Unfortunately, she was not able to attend university for financial reasons. She would have liked to study social work.

Thanks to her entrepreneurial spirit and her desire to get ahead, she has sold plastic items for 14 years. She works 12 hours a day and is very happy to do so. This is her way of life. In the photo, you can see Marlene with her business.

Marlene is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their support she will be able to invest and have capital to stock her business. She will purchase items such as baskets, buckets, plastic cups, disposable products, water bottles, kegs, jugs, and thermos bottles. This way, she will be able to maintain her business and increase her income in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase plastic items such as baskets, buckets, plastic cups, disposable items, water bottles, kegs, jugs, and thermos bottles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes for the winter season in large quantity to add to her new ones.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Ms Fozia, age 32, makes artificial flowers to earn an income. She offers various colorful flowers for decorating homes and for events like birthdays or parties. She has been successfully running her flower-making business for the past year. Her husband works as a laborer and earns insufficient income to support her family with his income alone, so she is motivated to grow her business in order to better provide for her family.

Ms Fozia sells her flowers to the people of her community and also supplies the local market. She has good communication skills and has a solid client list.

In order to expand her business, she has requested a loan in the amount of PKR 10,000 in order to buy raw material such as fabric, glace papers, and packs of paints in various colors. In this way, she will be able to meet consistently with the increasing demands of her customers. 

She intends to her expected profits on meeting the expenses of her family and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as fabric, glace papers, and packs of paints in various colors

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena de 60 años de edad, es una persona que ha trabajado a lo largo de su vida con mucha dedicación para salir adelante, vive junto a su esposo y junto a dos pequeños nietos que son responsabilidad total de ella. Elena trabaja vendiendo ropa para mujeres, niños y hombres, la cual comercializa de forma ambulante y así mismo en su casa de habitación, ofrece la ropa a buenos precios y es de buena calidad por lo que las personas la buscan mucho para que les muestre su productos. Elena solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el enorme deseo de mejorar sus ventas significativamente, aumentando la cantidad de ropa, surtiéndola en diferentes tallas, colores y estilos de moda, de forma que pueda estar vigente en la mente de las personas y estas las prefieran por tener ropa muy actual y a precios accesibles. Elena desea mucho mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y poder seguir dándole todo lo necesario a sus dos nietecitos que tanto la necesitan.
texts.en:
Elena, 60, is a person who has worked her entire life with much dedication in order to get ahead.  She lives with her husband and two small grandchildren who are her entire responsibility.  Elena works selling women’s, children’s and men’s clothes from place to place and also at home.  She sells good quality clothes at good prices so people seek he rout quite a bit to have her show them her goods.  

She’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan with the huge wish that her sales will improve significantly.  She will increase the amount of clothes stocking up on assorted sizes, colors and styles so that she can be up-to-date in people’s minds so that they will prefer her because she has current clothes at affordable prices.  Elena wants to improve her business’ condition very much to be able to continue giving her two little grandchildren who so need her what’s necessary.

loans.use: to buy a wider variety of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Tormonh

texts.en:
Tormonh, age 42, is a mechanic. He has been working at an auto repair service company for years. He lives with his wife and family in a ger (a traditional Mongolian yurt dwelling) in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His wife Mongontsetseg runs a small grocery store business at the local market. His son Purevgerel, age 18, studies at university, and his daughter Gerelsuren, age 16, goes to the local secondary school. 

Tormonh is now starting his own auto repair business on his own plot of land. He is well-known in town for providing good and qualified service. He is requesting 3.000,000 MNT in order to purchase spare parts to start his new business. He is a hard-working, open-minded, and modest man.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to start his new auto repair business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Mohamed's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are school teachers in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org, based in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone, to request a loan of SLL 8,500,000 for the entire group. 

With the help of this loan, this group of able and dedicated teachers will be able to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Sia (pictured in the middle) is the featured leader of this group. The 40-year-old is a native of Kayima, in eastern Sierra Leone. She is married to a teacher and the couple has three children who are attending secondary schools. Sia has served in the teaching profession for 12 years now. She has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Lisander Antonio

texts.es: Lisander de 38 años de edad, es un padre y esposo muy responsable y cariñoso con su familia que está conformada por su esposa y dos hijos menores de edad, quienes se dedican a estudiar. Lisander desde hace muchos años que ha trabajado en su propia panadería, creciendo poco a poco, surtiendo la cantidad de pan y así mismo adquiriendo nuevos clientes, actualmente Lisander desea darle lo mejor a sus hijos y que no les haga falta lo más fundamental en la vida como alimento, vestido y estudios, por lo que desea mejorar mucho más las condiciones de su negocio, equipándolo con más moldes, latas para hacer el pan y adquiriendo harina, azúcar, miel, manteca, huevos y todos la materia prima por mayor y cantidades más grandes, lo que le permita atender a más personas que hacen pedidos grandes, ya que anteriormente se veía obligado a no aceptar más trabajo por falta de materia prima. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para poder alcanzar su sueño de mejorar su negocio y así mismo sus ganancias. Lisander cuenta con el espíritu de trabajo y los deseos y las ganas de salir adelante por su familia.
texts.en:
Lisander, 38, is a very responsible, affectionate father and husband.  His family is composed of his wife and two minor children who attend school.  Lisander has worked for many years in his own bakery and has been gradually growing stocking more bread and acquiring new customers.  

Lisander currently wants to give the best to his children and they that lack none of life’s basics like food, clothes and schooling which is why he wants to improve his business’ condition much more.  He wants to stock it with more molds and pans to bake bread and to buy flour, sugar, honey, shortening, eggs and all raw materials at wholesale and in large amounts so that he can fill large customer orders since he used to have to refuse large orders due to lack of raw materials.

Because of this he’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to be able to reach his dream of improving his business and thus his profits.  Lisander has the spirit for work and the desire and drive to get ahead for his family

loans.use: to buy molds and other bread-baking raw materials.

loans.name: Nanuli

texts.en:
Nanuli, age 40, is involved in a family agricultural business in Mtskheta District, where she lives with her husband and their 24-year-old son. The sole source of income for the family is the agricultural business. They have a milk cow and produce cheese from its milk, which they sell on the open market in the capital city. 

Nanuli and her husband decided to start a new business, as their existing income is not enough to adequately provide for the family. With the loan funds, Nanuli will purchase a car and her husband will serve the local people as a taxi driver. They also will use the car in trading, which will save them the transportation costs of transporting their dairy products. Their overall income will increase and they will be able to improve the living conditions of the family. In addition, the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market in case of need.

Nanuli's loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provisions of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low incomes.

loans.use: to purchase a car, her husband to use it as Taxi

loans.name: G.s. Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es: Santos Francisca de 46 años de edad, viuda, cinco hijos de 15,18,23,27 y 29 años de edad  el cual solo uno estudia en secundaria los demás son independientes, Santos su negocio con el apoyo económico de su esposo el que falleció al tiempo de tener su negocio establecido desde ese momento ella tuvo que apoyarse con sus hijos mayores para poder seguir adelante ya que de dependían seis personas del negocio y entre ellos dos que estaban pequeños por lo que estos tenían que dejar de  estudiar para ayudar con el trabajo, pero hoy en día solo una hija le quedo porque ellos ahora son independientes una de sus metas es que su hija termine de estudiar en la universidad, su negocio consiste en la elaboración de pan de maíz para una posterior venta de este producto, está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de materia prima (Maíz) para la producción de la cosa De horno y así invertirlo en el negocio de su panadería,  ella pertenece al Grupo Solidario Dios es Amor el cual consiste en tres miembros, Julia Bertha 45 años de edad soltera con dos hijos 9 y 16 años de edad ambos estudiantes, su negocio consiste en la venta de mercadería general como ropa, zapatos, celulares, accesorios de Celulares, laminados de acero y plata entre otros negocio que ya tiene dos años, ella lo inicia con pocos recursos y poco a poco ha ido invirtiendo más su mercadería, ella viaja a panamá a comprar variedades de productos para poder ofrecerles a sus clientes, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito, solicita financiamiento para invertir más en su capital de trabajo, y Dany mayor de edad soltero a sus 28 años de edad, es propietario de una panadería el cual la tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Chinandega, negocio que inicia con muchos esfuerzos con dinero propio que pudo reunir cuando trabajaba con su mama en una panadería donde el aprende ese oficio y monta su propio negocio.  el realiza sus compras de materia prima Somotillo, sus ventas son al contado de manera ambulantes con clientes fijos como son los dueños de pulperías, él está solicitando financiamiento para capital de trabajo como es en compra de materia prima para su panadería, en estas comarcas existe una gran demanda de venta de ropa, y de productos comestibles es una localidad donde predomina la ganadería y agricultura ellos están necesitan solicitando financiamiento por primera vez para surtir más sus negocios y están agradecidos por el apoyo que se les está brindando  para continuar con sus negocios.
texts.en: Santos Francisca  is 46 years old, a widow, and the mother of five children of 15, 18, 23, 27, and 29.
