Only one of her children is still in secondary education, with the others now being independent.  Santos set up her business with financial support from her husband who died when the business had become established.  From that moment she had to lean on her older children to get by, as six people were dependent on the business.  With two of the children still small, the older ones had to give up their studies to help with the work, but now only one daughter is still dependent as the older ones have left home.  One of Santos Francisca's ambitions is to see her daughter complete her university education.  Her business consists of making and selling corn bread.  She is seeking funding to buy raw materials (corn) for the production of 'cosa de horno' (a type of corn bread) and will invest it in her bakery business.  She belongs to the Dios es Amor (God is Love) solidarity group, along with the two other members, Julia Bertha and Dany.  Julia Bertha is 45 years old, single and the mother of two children of 9 and 16, who are both at school.  Her business consists of selling general merchandise such as clothing, shoes, mobile phones and accessories, laminated steel and silver, amongst other things.  She has had this business for two years, having begun with scant resources and having gradually invested more in her merchandise.  She travels to Panama to buy different ranges of products to offer to her customers.   She sells for cash and on credit and is seeking funding to invest more in her working capital.  Dany, who is 28 and single, owns his own bakery which is located in his home in Chinandega.  He devoted tremendous effort to setting up his business with his own money which he managed to scrape together during the time that he worked with his mum in the bakery where he learned the trade.  He buys his raw materials in Somotilla and travels around selling his goods for cash to regular clients such as grocery shops.  In these regions there is a great demand for clothing sales and foodstuffs as it is a region devoted predominantly to cattle rearing and agriculture.  This is the first time that the group’s members have sought funding to increase their stocks and they are grateful for any support which will help them to continue running their businesses.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, some for her bakery business and some for general merchandise

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Ms Rani is a 40-year-old, married woman, and the mother of four children. For the past 25 years, Rani has been running a business of carpet manufacturing. Her husband is a government employee, but his salary is not enough to meet home expenses, which are increasing day by day. This compelled Rani to work, herself, to contribute to the family's income.  She is also doing sewing as her part-time job. In this way, she is able to handle her family's needs and requirements efficiently.

She makes carpets with a special kind of wood, known as "dub wood." These carpets are used in mosques, for the purpose of prayer. By this time, she has become popular in her community for providing good-quality carpets.  

In order to purchase a stock of dub wood and some utensils, such as cutters and scissors, she applied to Kashf Foundation for a second loan, of PKR 30,000. The loan capital will help her to increase her production of carpets, and increase her sales. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of wood and some utensils, such as cutters and scissors.

loans.name: Ludy Elisa

texts.es:
Santa Rosa del Peñón, es un Pequeño Pueblo con muchas características de comercio, es aquí donde habita la joven Ludy Elisa. 

Ludy se llama la Joven de 28 años de edad  es casada, con un hijito bajo su cargo, con lo poco que su esposo gana en su trabajo mantiene en el sustento diario de su familia, pero son de sus sueños vivir en una mejor vivienda, brindarle a su hijo un mejor techo.

Se le presente la oportunidad de conocer a Ceprodel y Kiva que estos ayudan a este tipo de persona, viendo de gran Necesidad es mejorar su vivienda, solicita un crédito para la compra de: Cemento y arena, seria de sus grandes sueños darle un repello a las paredes de su vivienda por lo que se encuentran deterioradas por fenómenos naturales. 

 "Agradece al gran Dios todo Poderoso, por haber conocido a Kiva y Ceprodel ya que son de sus sueños que estos le financien el crédito para poder vivir en una mejor vivienda".
texts.en:
Santa Rosa del Peñón is a small town with many commercial characteristics; this is where young Ludy Elisa lives.  Ludy is the name of this 28-year-old young woman.  She’s married and has a son in her care.  With the little her husband earns the family’s daily sustenance is maintained but her dream is to live in a better house and to provide a better roof for her son.

She got the opportunity to get to know Kiva and Ceprodel who help this type of person.  Seeing the great need for home improvements, she’s asking for a loan to buy cement and sand.  One of her great dreams is to plaster the walls of her house which are currently in bad shape due to natural phenomena.

She thanks God Almighty for having known Kiva and Ceprodel because her dream is that they finance the loan so she can live in a better house.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand.

loans.name: Angela Mercedes

texts.es: Angela Mercedes, de 33 años de edad soltera con dos hijos de 17 y 12 años de edad solo uno estudia, ella se dedica a la venta de Dulces como Cajetas, bollos de coco, agua de coco al igual que vende ropa de niños y ropa interior ella vende en las paradas de buses de Chinandega,  el Bisne y también vende en pulperias tiene clientes fijos y eventuales da crédito y lo recupera semanal y quincenal, Angela inicia su negocio con poco dinero propio, ella aprende desde muy joven este negocio gracias a su mama el cual la experiencia que tiene es de 18 años de edad, viene de una familia muy pobre y humilde con muchos esfuerzos y deseos de superación a logrado sacar adelante a sus dos hijos sola, vive en una humilde casa de lata la cual uno de sus sueños es el poder mejorar sus vivienda y darle seguridad a sus hijos ella esta solicitando financiamiento para capital de trabajo como: azucar, maiz, dulces, coco entre otros  y así invertir mas ya que su clientela ha incrementado aun mas.
texts.en:
Angela Mercedes, 33, is single with two children who are 17 and 12 years old; only one of them attends school.  She works selling sweets like caramel, coconut balls and coconut water and also sells children’s clothes and underwear; she works at bus stops in Chinandega, in El Bisne and also sells to grocery stores where she has regular customers and occasional ones.  She sells on credit and collects weekly and biweekly.

Angela started her business with a little money of her own; she learned this business at a young age from her mother.  She’s been in business since the age of 18.  She comes from a very poor, humble family and with much effort and a strong drive to improve she’s been able to support her two children alone.  She lives in a humble, metal sheeting house and one of her dreams is to improve her dwelling and provide security for her children.  She’s requesting a loan to use as working capital to invest more in things like sugar, corn, and candies because her clientele has increased still more.

loans.use: to buy sweets.

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi is 28 years old, single, and has two children. She lives in the suburban town of Kisauni in a house she rents.

For the past three years, Kibibi has been been operating a sewing business making garments. She also mends all types of clothing. This business is her source of income and she has a good clientele. Kibibi wants to maintain materials in her inventory and offer better service to her customers. She currently has many orders to fill but she does not have enough working capital to do this.

This is why she is requesting a loan for buying fabric, zippers, buttons, and lace. As a result, she will be able to provide better service to her customers and generate more profit.

loans.use: to buy fabric, zippers, buttons, and lace.

loans.name: Malcolm Yayah's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva based in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of secondary school teachers. They are from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone.

These hard-working and dedicated teachers have come to SMT to request a loan of SLL 23,900,000 for the entire group. With their shares of the loan, each will be able to solve his immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will be able to repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the salary deductions and making the repayments on the borrowers' behalf. 

Mafinda (who is second from the left in the picture) is the featured leader of this group. A native of Yengema, in eastern Sierra Leone, the 55-year-old is married to a teacher. The couple has two children, who are no longer attending school. Mafinda has served in the teaching profession for 25 years. He has requested this loan in order to buy building materials, for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to buy building materials, for the construction of a house

loans.name: Danilo Manuel

texts.es:
Santa Rosa del Peñón un bello Pueblito ubicada en el departamento de León, donde existen muchas personas emprendedoras, es aquí donde vive el joven Danilo Manuel. 

Danilo Manuel se llama el Joven de 53 años edad Luchador por su vida y la de su familia, cuenta con dos hijos bajo su cargo quienes con tanto sacrificio mantienen los gastos de colegiatura.

 Hoy en día se le ha presentado un problema en su salud por lo que se vio en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para poder comprar sus medicamento que son tan caros, pero tiene la fe en Dios que esto solo lo puede lograr con un crédito que le financie Kiva Y Ceprodel. 

"Agradece a este tipo de personas que ayudan con crédito y que siempre piensan en las personas pobres de darle la oportunidad de poder salir adelante en su vida, con una vida saludable un mejor vivir para su familia, de igual forma le permite desarrollar mejor su trabajo".
texts.en:
Santa Rosa del Peñón is a beautiful little town located in León Department where there are many enterprising people; young Danilo Manuel lives here.  Danilo Manuel is the name of this young man.  He’s 53-years-old and has striven for his and his family’s life.  He has two children in his care and with much sacrifice is able to pay their tuition costs.

Today, he’s facing a health problem which has forced him to seek a loan to be able to buy the medicine that’s so expensive but he trusts in God that he will be able to achieve this with the loan Kiva and Ceprodel finance for him.

He is grateful for this type of people who help with the loan and always think of giving poor people the opportunity to be able to get ahead in life with a healthier life and better well-being for their family; it also allows him to better carry out his work.

loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Rehmat

texts.en:
Ms Rehmat is a 54-year-old, married woman, and a mother of two. She has been running a business of buffalo milk production and sales, for 10 years. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family, at a time when her husband was the only bread earner. With the passage of time, her sales increased and also her income. Now she has two buffaloes. This has all happened due to her courage and determination.

Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income, as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo for milk production.

loans.name: Darling José

texts.es:
Santa Rosa del Peñón una bella ciudad ubicada en el departamento de León, donde existen muchas personas emprendedoras, es aquí donde vive el joven Darling José. 

Darling José se llama el Varón de 31 años edad Luchador por su vida y la de sus dos hijos quienes con tanto sacrificio mantiene los gastos de colegiatura, pero son de sus grande sueño poderle dar un mejor techo donde estos jovencitos puedan vivir en mejores condiciones. 

Hoy en día se dio cuenta que Ceprodel y Kiva están Financiando crédito para las personas luchadora como él, por tan razón solicita un Crédito para la compra de. Arena, Cemento y Pago de mano de Obra, esto sería de sus grandes sueños vivir en mejores condiciones con su familia.
texts.en:
Santa Rosa del Peñón is a beautiful little town located in León Department where there are many enterprising people; young Darling José lives here.  Darling José is the name of this 31-year-old man who has striven for his and his two children’s lives.  With much sacrifice he’s able to pay their school tuition costs but his great dream is to be able to provide a better roof over their heads so these young boys can live under better conditions.

Today, he noticed that Ceprodel and Kiva are financing loans for hardworking people like him which is why he’s requesting a loan to buy sand, cement and to pay labor costs.  This would be one of his great dreams: to live with his family under better conditions.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Yron Antonio

texts.es:
Santa Rosa del Peñón es un pequeño pueblo, donde existen diversas actividades comerciales, es aquí donde habita El Joven Yron Antonio de 35 años de edad.

Yron es casada, su esposa trabaja como empleada doméstica, con lo poco que ella gana ayuda en el sustento diario de su casa, cuentan con 4 hijitos bajo su cargo, pero es de sus sueños vivir en una mejor vivienda. 

Yron cuenta con su buena salud, su capacidad de trabajo, su honradez que es lo que la ha mantenido bien a su familia,

 Hoy en día se dio cuenta que Ceprodel Y Kiva apoyaba a este tipo de persona, por tal Razón Solicita un crédito para la compra de: Zin y Madera, Esto sería de gran importancia porque aprovecharían mejorar un poco el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Santa Rosa del Peñón is a small town with various commercial activities; this is where young Yron Antonio, 35, lives.  Yron is married and his wife works as a domestic employee.  With the little she earns she helps him cover daily household expenses.  They have four small children in their care but one of his dreams is to live in a better house.  Yron is in good health and his capacity for work and his honesty is what’s kept him well with his family.

He’s noted these days that Ceprodel and Kiva support his type of person and because of this he’s asking for a loan to buy metal sheeting and lumber.  This would be of great importance because they’d be able to improve the roof on the house somewhat.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting and lumber.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
Clotilde de 33 años es una mujer soltera con bastante ímpetu y dedicación familiar. Es una hija muy abnegada ya que su trabajo lo dedica a sus padres quienes en una edad muy avanzada se sienten muy contentos por contar con una hija muy atenta y trabajadora. Es poseedora de una vivienda construida a base de adobe que heredó de sus padres.
Dedicada a las actividades agrícolas se considerada una mujer muy trabajadora, desde hace 15 años se inició en la producción de cacao orgánico gracias a las parcelas que sus padres le cedieron y  hasta hoy le permite sustentar su hogar.
Para agilizar las tareas respecto a su producción cuenta con el apoyo de jornaleros quienes la apoyan en las labores de deshierbo, abono e injertado de almácigos.
Se encuentra iniciándose una nueva campaña productiva paralela a la temporada lluviosa, es cuando desea de manera inmediata contar con capital para abonar sus árboles cacaoteros y reemplazar algunas plantaciones desfasadas.
El mantener sus productos con el mantenimiento al día beneficia de manera considerable  en obtener una calidad óptima bien remunerada por los acopiadores de la zona.
Sus deseos a largo plazo apuntan a la apertura de un negocio consistente en una tienda de abarrotes paralelo a sus actividades agrícolas. Desea contar con 2,500 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico guano de isla, así como para el anticipo a los jornaleros para trabajos de deshierbo y abonado de las plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en:
Clotilde is a 33-year-old, single woman. She is very energetic and dedicated to her family. She is a self-sacrificing daughter, who devotes herself to her aging parents. They are very happy to have such an attentive and hardworking daughter.

Clotilde owns an adobe house that she inherited from her parents. She makes a living in agriculture, which has always taught her to work hard. She began producing cocoa when she was 15 years old, on some plots of land her parents gave her to work. Since then, she has made a living for herself off of this land. To accelerate the production process, Clotilde hires day labor to help with the weeding, fertilizing, and grafting seedlings. 

She will be starting a new growing season when the rainy season arrives, so she will need enough capital to fertilize her cocoa trees and to replant some outdated plots of land. Daily maintenance of the plants considerably helps her to obtain the best quality product to sell at the best prices collectors in the region offer. Clotilde's long-term goals include opening a grocery store alongside her agricultural activity. 

She is requesting a loan of 2,500 Peruvian soles in order to buy organic fertilizer: guano de la isla, as well as to pay the wages of the day workers who weed and fertilize her cocoa plants.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers, such as bird droppings, and to pay day laborer's wages.

loans.name: Sahr Emmanuel's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are primary school teachers in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org, based in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone, to request a loan of SLL 4,300,000 for the entire group. 

With the help of this loan, this group of able and dedicated teachers will be able to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Sahr (pictured in the middle) is the featured leader of this group. The 54-year-old is a native of Sagbe, in eastern Sierra Leone. He is married to a teacher and the couple have eight children, five of whom are attending secondary schools. Sahr has served in the teaching profession for 33 years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children and to use the rest to buy house-building materials.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children and to buy house-building materials.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is 45 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma, in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has five children, who are all currently in school. For the past four years, Farida has been working hard to manage her poultry farm; she sells chickens. 

To help expand her business, Farida has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. She will use the loan to buy more broiler chicks. This use of the loan funds will help Farida to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Farida hopes that in the future she will be able to build more rental houses. 

Farida is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Farida, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to buy more broiler chicks.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Félix, es divorciado y tiene cinco hijos pero solo dependen de el dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, vive en casa propia ocupando cuatro habitaciones compartiendo con las dependencias con sus hijos, la casa esta ubicado cerca de un cerro y casi al borde de un barranco, la casa es de adobe de barro y paja y las paredes están revocadas con estuco y el piso es de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Pasankeri central de la ciudad de La Paz.

Actualmente trabaja como empleado albañil en una empresa de construcción,  trabajando en la misma zona realizando un campo deportivo percibiendo un salario mensual; Felix se hace cargo de los pagos de servicios básicos de su familia.

El crédito lo requiere para realizar la refacción de una habitación en su domicilio, el adobe de su casa se fue desgastando por las lluvias y las calaminas ya están muy usados y necesita cambiar todo y así mejorar su calidad de vida.

El sueño de Félix es que sus hijos menores sean profesionales y puedan valerse por si solos y así mejorar su calidad de vida.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
Félix is divorced and has five children but only two of them who are still school age depend on him.  He lives in his own, four-room house sharing all the space with his children.  The house is located near a hill almost at the edge of a cliff.  It’s made of mud adobe and straw and the walls are stuccoed and the floor is dirt.  The house is located in the city of La Paz’s Pasankeri Central zone.

He currently works as a salaried worker for a construction company working in the same zone building a sports field; he earns a monthly salary.  Félix pays his family’s basic utility expenses.  

He needs the loan to do some home improvements.  The adobe in his house is worn down by the rain and the plywood is very used and needs to be replaced in its entirety to improve his quality of life.

Félix’s dream is that his younger children become professionals and can fend for themselves thus improving their quality of life.  This is his first loan request to IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy adobe and plywood.

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es: Carlos Manuel mayor de edad, Acompañado  con dos hijos 20 y 22 años ahora mayores de edad,hace dos años ellas estaban estudiando y estaban bajo su resposabilidad en la actualidad ya no, anteriormente su negocio era una pulperia, cuatro años despues inicia su negocio de venta de mercaderia en general, el cual tiene ya 10 años de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio donde consiste en la venta de ropa interior, cosméticos, chinería, ropa variadas y otros, el compra en Managua a comerciantes de Chinandega,  al igual también tiene en su negocio la venta de Accesorios de repuestos de Bicicletas entre otros , vende a pulperías y otros tiene cliente fijos y eventuales da crédito y lo recupera semanal y quincenal, Carlos conoce muy bien a sus clientes los cuales ahora demandan más variedades de productos, lo que en su momento se le es difícil mantener inventario de mercadería ya que este las distribuye, él está muy agradecido con los inversionistas Kiva porque le han brindado la oportunidad de salir adelante en su negocio y así brindarle una mejor vida a su familia.   Actualmente él está solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para la compra de ropa de niños y adultos, y otra parte en compra de accesorios de Bicicletas
texts.en:
Carlos is an adult with a common-law spouse and two children, ages 20 and 22.  For 10 years he has made a living selling general merchandise such as underwear, cosmetics, china, a variety of clothing, and other things.  He buys in Managua for merchants in Chinandega.  In his business he also sells bicycle parts and accessories.  He sells to grocery stores and others.

He has regular and occasional customers.  He gives credit and collects weekly and biweekly.  Carlos knows his customers very well and they request more product variety.  What's difficult for him in his time is to keep his inventory because he distributes it.

He's very grateful to the Kiva lenders because they have given him the opportunity to get ahead in his business and give his family a better life.

Currently he's requesting another loan to buy clothing for children and adults and, with part of it, bicycle accessories.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing, cosmetics, china, bicycle parts, and other merchandise

loans.name: Irrine

texts.en:
Irrine is a person who has values, such as honesty, humility, respect, and hard work, that were emphasized by her parents. These qualities have shaped who she is and have allowed her to set an example for her four children. She has been involved in selling fruits and vegetables for the past two years.

She is requesting a loan from Yehu so that she can buy produce, such as tomatoes, potatoes, bananas, kale and onions. Her work requires great sacrifice, yet she performs her duties with great care because she knows that she will be able to put food on the table each day.

Her dream is to expand her business into a mini-market.

loans.use: to buy more produce to resell, such as tomatoes, potatoes, bananas and kale.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
The enthusiasm to improve herself is one of the many goals Dama has. She lives with her family in a rental house. 

She has already been in the business for one year after migrating from another town, and that has given her valuable sales experience that allows her to earn reasonable profits to help her husband. She sells charcoal in a small stall outside her residential area. She has gotten many customers who prefer her for excellent service.

She is a determined woman, devoted to her work. Every day she does her best to secure a better future. Each day she strives to the maximum, as she is happy with her work and doesn't want to let her family down. Dama is asking for loan to boost her business. With this loan, she will be able to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Dama knows she has good payment references and is very responsible. She promises to pay back the debt, and at the same time has confidence that she can bring financial security to her modest household.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Hada Rubidia

texts.es: de 51 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa para mujeres y hombres, así mismo vende cubre camas, cortinas, manteles y otros artículos más, ella vende sus productos en el mercado central de su lugar de vivienda, con vecinos, diferentes departamentos y con personas aledañas a su lugar de vivienda. Hada es una persona responsable y muy amable lo que le permite contar con más clientes quienes les agradan comprar sus productos por la amabilidad con que las trata. Hada solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para poder contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de ropa interior femenina y masculina, así mismo para comprar cortinas de diferentes precios y estampados al igual que con los manteles, que son de los productos con más demanda. Hada desea mucho salir adelante ya que ella vive sola y no posee ayuda de nadie, por lo que su negocio es fundamental para su estabilidad.
texts.en: 51-year-old Hada sells clothes for women and men. She also sells bed covers, curtains, tablecloths and other articles. Hada sells her products at the central market and at home, to her neighbors and people surrounding her dwelling place. Hada is responsible and very friendly which allows her to have more customers who prefer to buy her products because they enjoy her kindness. Hada is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL, in order to have enough money to invest in the purchase of male and female underwear, curtains of diverse patterns and prices and tablecloths, which are the products with more demand. Hada is invested to get ahead because she lives alone and has no support from anyone. This is why her business is crucial for her stability.

loans.use: Purchase underwear to sell

loans.name: Tuzanyumwete Group

texts.fr:
Inès fait partie du groupe Tuzanyumwete et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 28 ans et est mariée à Antoine, un banquier. Ensemble ils ont  2 enfants, âgés de 2 à 4 ans, dont 1 étudie.
Elle a sous  sa charge 2 orphelins, l’un des deux étudie.

Elle fait le commerce de boutique (riz,  farine de manioc et de maïs, huile de palme,…) depuis 2 ans.  

Elle est à son douzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup  d’articles  de  sa boutique (riz, un casier de limonade,…), pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait renforcer son commerce pour  dégager un bénéfice  capable de  faire vivre la famille  même en absence de son mari, et constituer un héritage à ses enfants. Elle voudrait en outre voir ses enfants étudier pour  se faire vivre.
texts.en:
Inès is a member of the Tuzanyumwete group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 28 years old and is married to Antoine, a banker. They have two children, two and four years of age, one of whom is in school. She also has two orphans in her care, one of whom is in school.

She has been selling grocery items (rice, manioc and corn flour, palm oil etc) for two years.
She is on her 12th loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan that she has obtained, she will bolster her capital and buy more groceries for her store (rice, a case of lemonade etc) in order to earn more.

In the years to come, she would like to strengthen her business in order to make enough living to support her family even in the absence of her husband, and provide a “nest egg” to her children. She would also like to see her students study in order to make a living.

loans.use: to bolster her capital and buy more groceries for her store (rice, a case of lemonade etc) in order to earn more.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa de 46 años de edad madre soltera con una hija de 23 años, el cual está cursando su Carrera universitaria. Y está bajo la responsabilidad de su mama. Teresa es originaria de Chinandega lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Es un mujer trabajadora, responsable, y que por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, y es la razón para apoyar a su hija para que tenga un futuro mejor.
Gracias a su tenacidad, y sus ganas de superación tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general, la cual consisten en venta de perfumees, crema de cuerpos, cosméticos, ropa de niño, pantalones, camisas, faldas, ropa interior. Actividad que la desempeña hace diez años, de forma ambulante. Su rutina de trabajo es unas 10 horas diarias, ofreciendo su mercadería con un bulto de unos 20 kg, actividad de la cual se siente muy a gusto porque ha sido el medio de trabajo que le ayuda a sacar adelante a su hija. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con la compra de mercadería en general, para que en un futuro no muy lejano poder tener mejores ingresos económicos. Teresa agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua.
texts.en:
Teresa is a 46-year-old single mother with one 23-year-old daughter. Her daughter is pursuing a degree in a university and is still supported by her mom. Teresa is a native of Chinandega, a place that is located in the western part of the country. She is a hardworking, responsible woman who was unable to pursue a university degree because she lacked financial resources. For that reason, she is supporting her daughter so that she might have a better future. 

Thanks to her tenacity and her desire to improve herself, she has a business selling general merchandise, such as perfumes, body creams, cosmetics, children's clothing, pants, shirts, skirts, and underwear. She has had this street-vending business for ten years. Her work routine is to sell her merchandise out of a 20-kilogram bag for ten hours a day. She is happy with this business activity because it has been her means of helping her daughter to get ahead. 

Her objective for this loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her business with general merchandise so that she can have a better income in the not-so-distant future. Teresa is thankful for the help that the Kiva lenders offer to disadvantaged people in poor countries like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock her business with merchandise like perfumes, body creams, cosmetics, children's clothing, pants, shirts, skirts, and underwear.

loans.name: Luisa Francisca

texts.es: Luisa Francisca 44 años de edad, casada con cinco hijos de 26,24,22,19 y 17 de edad, solo uno no estudia, Luisa es una persona muy trabajadora se dedica a  brindar el servicio de docente activa en una escuela de primaria, ella poco a poco ha ido mejorando su vivienda está muy agradecida con el apoyo que Fundación León 2000, le ha brindado en créditos anteriores ha  logrado comprar materiales para realizar algunas mejoras en su hogar, su vida ha cambiado con esta apoyo que se le ha dado porque siente que ahora tiene una mejor protección para sus hijos, Luisa está solicitando financiamiento para la realizar ciertas mejoras en su hogar( el arreglo de un cuarto para su hijo menor) como la compra de materiales de construcción: cemento, arena, zin, mano de obra, pintura, hierro y otros materiales más. Uno de su deseo es ir mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en: Luisa Francisca, 44, is married and has five children aged 26, 24, 22, 19 and 17 years.  Only one of them is still in school.  Luisa is a very hardworking person who works as an elementary school teacher.  She’s gradually been doing home improvements and is very grateful for the support she’s been given because with her previous loans she was able to buy supplies to do some of the home improvements.  Her life has changed with the support she’s been given because now she has better protection for her children.  Luisa has requested financing to do some home improvements (to fix up her youngest son’s bedroom).  She will buy building supplies like cement, sand, metal sheeting, paint, rebar and other supplies and will also pay labor costs.  One of her wishes is to continue improving her home.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна - предприниматель, торгует на рынке женской одеждой. Предыдущий кредит Татьяна использовала для закупки товара к праздникам. 

Муж Татьяны занимается грузоперевозками, а также доставляет Татьяне товар для ее бизнеса. Благодаря дополнительной прибыли в прошлом году Татьяна вместе с мужем продали старый микроавтобус и купили новый. Теперь он сможет брать заказы на более длительные расстояния по всей Украине.

В этот раз Татьяна хочет пополнить ассортимент своего товара, закупив кофты, брюки и свитера. Она уверена, что широкий ассортимент поможет ей удержать постоянных покуапателей и привлечь новых.
texts.en:
Tatyana - an entrepreneur, sells women's clothing at the market.  Tatyana used her previous loan to purchase products for the holidays.

Tatyana's husband is a truck driver and also delivers products to Tatyana for her business.  Thanks to additional earnings last year Tatyana and her husband sold an old minibus and bought a new one.  Now he will be able to take orders for further distances all around Ukraine.

This time Tatyana would like to supplement her product assortment by buying cardigans, pants and sweaters.  She is sure that a large assortment of products will allow her to keep regular customers and attract new ones.

loans.use: to purchase cardigans, pants and sweaters

loans.name: Mirzonasim

texts.ru: Мирзонасим очень талантливый молодой человек. Он родился в семье простых рабочих. Так как у его родителей не было образования, он с детства мечтал поступить в университет и получить высшее образование и найти хорошую работу. С такой целью после окончания средней школы, он поступил в Таджикский Государственный Университет Политики и Бизнеса по специальности Экономика и управления предприятия. Данное время он является студентом 2 курса. Он старается быть успешным в учебе и обществе и у него это получается. Мирзонасим еще не женился и живет с родителями. Его родители не в состоянии в этом году оплатить за учебный договор. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы в университете. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mirzonasim is a very talented young man.  He was born in a family of ordinary laborers.  Because his parents did not have an education, he has dreamed of attending university since childhood, of receiving a good education and of finding a good job.  With this goal after finishing high school he enrolled in Tajik State University of Politics and Business specializing in Economics and Business Administration.  Right now he is a second year student.  He tries to be successful in his studies and in society and is able to do this.  Mirzonasim is not married and lives with his parents.  His parents are not able to pay tuition this year.  He is asking for a loan to pay tuition at the university.  He is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition

loans.name: Katkot Group

texts.en:
Katkot Group consists of four women who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. 

Jabra, 45, lives with her children in Hodeidah, Yemen. After the death of her children's father, she became the only source of income. For one year now, she has been working on selling perfumes, incense, and cloths. 

To help her continue on with her business operations, Jabra and her group have applied for a loan of YER 130,000. Jabra will use her portion to buy more quantities of perfumes, incense, cloth, henna tubes, and other materials for her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business which, in turn, will allow her to get her own shop.

loans.use: to buy more quantities of perfumes, incense, cloth, henna tubes, and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en:
Adwowa is married and has two children. Her husband is a carpenter. She is a food vendor who sells maize porridge, rice, eggs, and ground nuts in Wakrom, near Cape Coast. She uses her income to assist her husband with the general upkeep of their family. 

Adwowa is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase bags of maize, rice, eggs, and ground nuts to sell. With her profits, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize, rice, eggs, and ground nuts to sell.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is a petty trader who sells palm fruit, cassava, and plantains in Wokrom near Cape Coast. She has done this work for two years now. Esi is married to a mason and has five children.  She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees.  

Esi need a loan from Kiva to enable her to purchase more palm fruit, cassava, plantains and other types of foods to sell. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit, cassava, plantains and other types of foods to sell.

loans.name: Esha

texts.en: Esha is requesting a new loan from Yehu to expand her charcoal business. She wants to stock her store with more sacks of charcoal. She is a responsible woman who can be trusted with more loans since she does not want to fall into the trap of being a defaulter.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jonathan Saul

texts.es:
Jonathan es un hombre joven de 24 años, no tuvo la oportunidad de instruirse con una educación completa, pero aprobó la escuela primaria y desde niño ayudó a sus padres en las labores de agricultura. Es soltero y no tiene hijos y vive en el cantón Santo Domingo de la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas. Santo Domingo se encuentra conectando la Región Sierra con la Región Costa del Ecuador, es una ciudad que se ha convertido en un eje comercial con varios sectores en crecimiento y como prueba se tiene a varias familias emprendedoras que hace algunos años comenzaron con pequeños negocios y ahora son microempresarios que aportan a la generación de empleo. Los estudios revelan que todos los negocios en su mayoría, empezaron empíricamente y han tenido acogida por el paso de turistas, empresarios y viajeros que se trasladan de una región a otra y además que es la tercera ciudad más habitada en el país. Jonathan reside en la Parroquia Luz de América de este cantón, un sector que es considerado como el portón de entrada a la Provincia, por la riqueza de su tierra ha sido el nido de varias empresas productoras de alimentos además que es la zona de mayor producción de papaya, fruta exótica exportada desde aquí. Es por esto que los habitantes de esta parroquia en su gran mayoría, se dedican a la agricultura, lo cual ha sido la motivación para que varios emprendedores de la zona fortalezcan esta actividad con su trabajo, experiencia y  esfuerzo.
Jonathan se dedica a la crianza de codornices un ave literalmente pequeña que necesita varios cuidados especiales principalmente en su alimentación para que puedan conservar su postura y además para que produzcan huevos sanos que puedan ser comercializados, además de su carne que también puede ser comercializada. En Ecuador esta práctica es una actividad relativamente nueva y ha dado rentabilidad a muchas personas que han emprendido con esta idea. Los huevos de codorniz tienen propiedades nutritivas y saludables, lo que los hace apetecidos por varios usuarios y lo convierte en un negocio interesante. 
Jonathan empezó su negocio hace 8 años, aprovechando las condiciones climáticas que ofrece su ciudad, pues Santo Domingo reúne varias características para desarrollar esta actividad. El invierte en esta actividad hasta 8 horas cada día; en la mañana sale a recorrer las calles  con un coche ambulante en donde lleva huevos cocinados y también crudos para la venta y en la tarde se dedica al cuidado, limpieza y mantenimiento de los criaderos. Por la experiencia que ha adquirido se siente preparado para dar un paso de crecimiento en su negocio, para lo cual requiere un préstamo que lo utilizará para compra de aves y por ende la instalación de más criaderos. Jonathan recurrió a Fundación Alternativa por referencia de varios amigos y por la seguridad y confianza que le brindaron allí, agradece por el apoyo.
texts.en:
Jonathan, 24, is a man who did not have the opportunity of completing his schooling but he did complete elementary school and since he was a boy has helped his parents with their work in agriculture.  He’s single and has no children and lives in Santo Domingo Canton in Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas Province.  

Santo Domingo is located connecting the mountain and coastal regions of Ecuador; it is a city that’s become a commercial crossroads with several sectors in development.  As proof of this, there are many enterprising families here who started out with small businesses a few years ago and now are micro business owners who generate employment.  Studies have shown that all the business for the most part started out empirically and have been well-received by tourists, businessmen and travelers who move from one region to the other; in addition, this is the country’s third most populous city.

Jonathan lives in this canton’s Luz de América Parish, a sector considered to be the province’s point of entry.  Because of the richness of its soil it’s become the home of various food exporting firms and this is the area with the largest papaya production, an exotic fruit that’s exported from here.  Because of this, residents in this parish are for the most part in agriculture which is why several of the local entrepreneurs have strengthened their activities with hard work, experience and effort.

Jonathan works raising quail, a small fowl that requires special treatment, especially with regard to its feeding so that they can stay healthy and produce healthy eggs that can be sold.  In addition, their meat can also be sold.  In Ecuador, this is a relatively new activity and it’s produced profits for many people who have gone into this business.  Quail eggs have nutritional and health properties that make them attractive to many consumers and turns them into an interesting business.

Jonathan started his business 8 years ago taking advantage of the city’s climactic conditions because Santo Domingo has several of the characteristics needed for this activity’s development.  He spends up to 8 hours daily in this activity.  During the morning he wanders the streets with his cart where he carries cooked eggs and raw eggs to sell and in the afternoon he works caring for and cleaning the coops.  Due to the experience he’s acquired he feels well-prepared to take a step toward increasing business and needs a loan to buy more fowl and to build more coops.  Jonathan came to Fundación Alternativa referenced by several friends and because of the security and trust he found there; he’s grateful for the support.

loans.use: to buy quails.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es: Mauricio, está casado, tiene la edad de 29 años, vive son su esposa y su hija que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito pretende comprar la materia para la elaboración de sus trabajos, el se dedica a realizar trabajos de tapicería dando mantenimiento de sillones y asientos a sus clientes. El se dedica ya desde hace varios años a esta profesión y ahora quiere ir dando un mejor servicio a sus clientes para que queden satisfechos aun más con su elaboración. El tiene pensado aumentar sus trabajo y así poder generar mas ganancias para salir adelante con el crédito y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida para su futuro. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Mauricio, 29, is married living with his wife and daughter who are his greatest priority.  He intends to use the loan to buy raw materials for his work.  He works as an upholsterer servicing sofas and chairs for his customers.  He’s been in this profession for years and now wants to provide better customer service so they will be even more satisfied with his work.  He’s thinking about increasing his work to earn higher profits to repay the loan and provide his family a better quality of life in future.  This is the first loan he’s gotten from Fudecosur.  He’s had no previous loans with state banks and Fudecosur offered the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy fabric and work tools.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa de 31 años es una mujer abnegada y dedicada a su familia, soltera  y con 2 grandes motivos de vida Jackelin de 10 añitos y Yasuri de 8 añitos por quienes madruga todos los días y brindarle así todo lo que una madre puede dar por sus hijos. Habita actualmente una vivienda construida a base de madera en calidad de alquiler.
Se inició en las actividades agrícolas gracias a unas parcelas que adquirió con la ayuda del padre de sus hijos para el sustento familiar, es así como desde hace 5 años se dedica a la producción integral de productos como el cacao orgánico por cierto uno de los más rentables en la región.
A diario debe madrugar y después de enviar a sus pequeñas al colegio se dirige a sus parcelas en donde actualmente con el apoyo de jornaleros se encuentra realizando el deshierbo de sus plantaciones necesario para lograr una producción de calidad.
Admite que el trabajo en el campo no es nada fácil puesto que requiere mucha dedicación y esmero, no obstante siente que gracias a ello se encuentra sacando adelante a su pequeña familia esperando que la salud y las ganas de trabajar no se ausenten en el largo periodo de llegar a convertir en grandes profesionales a sus hijas.
Tiene en mente concretar la compra de una parcela adicional para incrementar su producción y por consiguiente sus ingresos para el cual se encuentra trabajando de manera abnegada. Actualmente necesita contar con 2,000 nuevos soles con los cuales financiará el deshierbo de sus parcelas, adicional a ello desea adquirir sacos de abono orgánico consistente en guano de isla y algunas herramientas menores como tijera de podar, machetes entre otros.
texts.en:
Elsa is a 31-year-old, single woman with two great motivations in life: her daughters Jackelin, 10 years old, and Yasuri, 8 years old. She wakes up early each day in order to provide what she can for them. She is a self-sacrificing woman who is dedicated to her family. She is currently living in a rented wooden house. 

Elsa began working in agriculture on some plots of land she acquired with the help of her daughters' father. So, five years ago, she dedicated herself to the production of organic cocoa, which is one of the most profitable crops in the region. Each day, Elsa gets up early and send her daughters off to school before working on her land. She hires some day laborers to help with the large amount of weeding necessary to obtain a good-quality product. Her work in the fields is not easy, and requires much dedication and painstaking attention. Nevertheless, Elsa is grateful to have a way to help her family get ahead. She hopes that she remains in good health and continues to enjoy her work while she helps her daughters to study and become professionals.

Elsa plans to buy another plot of land in order to increase her production and, in turn, her profits, so she will continue to work tirelessly. Currently, she needs the capital of 2,000 Peruvian soles with which to finance the weeding of her land. Additionally, Elsa plans to buy some organic fertilizers such as guano de la isla, as well as some tools like pruning scissors, machetes, and others.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers and some tools, such as pruning scissors and machetes, etc.

loans.name: Denis Adolfo

texts.es: Denis es un joven de 25 años estudia la carrera de contabilidad pública y finanzas, es soltero trabaja como despachador de farmacia, con su salario paga la mensualidad de sus estudios así como también recibe el apoyo de su madre, para Denis la educación es muy importante ya que contribuye al desarrollo humano y con su titulo en mano podrá optar por un mejor empleo, el solicita apoyo de crédito para poder pagar su curso de titulación.
texts.en:
Denis is a 25-year-old, single man who works in a pharmacy. He is studying Public Accounting and Finance, and pays his monthly school fees with his salary from the pharmacy, as well as with the support of his mother. His education is very important to Denis because it helps him to develop as a person. Also, with his degree, he will be able to search for a well-paying job. 

Denis is requesting this loan in order to pay his graduation fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees for graduation.

loans.name: Carla

texts.es: La  Sra. Carla tiene 19 años, ella se dedica a la venta de variedad de artículos de primera necesidad como abarrotes, dulces, refrescos y variedad de artículos en su tienda de barrio,  que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Cupesi, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La  Sra. Carla va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de abarrotes para surtir su negocio como arroz, fideo, harina y azúcar por mayor para surtir su tienda  y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, La  Sra. Carla va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos, ya que esta época es de mucha demanda,  su deseo para su negocio es tener un almacén y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela.
texts.en: Carla, 19, sells variety of basic staples like groceries, candy, soft-drinks and various other items in her neighborhood store located in the Cupesi zone.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Carla will use it to buy a variety of grocery items like rice, noodles, flour and sugar at wholesale to stock her store and provide a variety of products for her customers.  Her reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving her store.  Carla will use profits to continue buying products and improving her income because this is a high demand season.  Her wish for her business is to have a warehouse to provide better customer service.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La  Sra. Martha tiene 46 años,  casada con 2 hijos que son de las edades de 17 y 10 años, La  Sra. Martha se dedica a la venta de variedad de artículos de higiene con champó jabón, jaboncillos, peines y toallas y variedad de artículos en su puesto de venta  que se encuentra ubicado en uno de los mercados de la zona Plan 3000, ella es cliente antigua dentro de la institución, La  Sra. Martha va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de artículos de limpieza para surtir su negocio y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, La  Sra. Martha va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en: Sra. Martha is 46-years old.  She is married and has two children, who are 17 and 10 years old.  Sra. Martha makes her living selling a variety of hygiene products, like shampoo, soap, tailor's chalk, brushes, towels and a variety of other articles.  She has a sales stall in one of the markets of the Plan 3000 area.  Sra. Martha is a long-time client of the institution.  She is going to use her loan to purchase a variety of cleaning supplies for stocking her business.  And in this way, she will be able to offer a variety of products to her customers.  Her reason for requesting this loan is to keep improving her business.  Sra. Martha is going to use the loan to keep purchasing products for re-sale and thereby improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Olga

texts.ru:
Ольга выращивает ранние овощи в теплицах. В прошлый раз она использовала кредит для установки системы полива в теплицах, а также закупки семян и удобрений. Урожалй был очень хороший. На вырученные деньги Ольга приобрела еще один участок земли рядом со своим и построила там еще две большие теплицы. 

Участок Ольги находится на краю села и бывает что по ночам воруют урожай. В этом году муж Ольги решил сделать сигнализацию, чтобы уберечь урожай от краж.

В этот раз Ольга просит предоставить ей кредит для закупки качественных семян и замены пленки на теплицах. Это позволит вовремя приготовиться к сезону и получить хорошую прибыль.
texts.en:
Olga grows early vegetables in greenhouses.  Last time she used her loan to install a watering system in the greenhouses and to purchase seeds and fertilizer.  The harvest was very good.  Using the earnings, Olga bought another plot of land next to hers and build two more large greenhouses there.  

Olga's plot is on the edge of the village and sometimes her crops are stolen at night.  This year, Olga's husband decided to install an alarm system in order to protect the crops from theft.  

This time Olga is asking for a loan to purchase high quality seeds and to replace the film on the greenhouses.  This will allow her to get ready for the season on time and to earn a good profit.

loans.use: to replace film on greenhouses and to purchase high quality seeds

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba cooks banku (a maize/cassava dough) for sale in Batanya, near Cape Coast. She serves the banku dish with fried fish, peppers, and tomato sauce and has done so for the past ten years. She is married with four children.  She uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of her family. 

Aba's loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and fish, which she uses in the preparation of her banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a stall for the sale of her cooked banku and fish.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish, which she uses in the preparation of her banku for sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 32, has been involved in tailoring for the past two years. This business helps her family meet household expenses and helps her pay for her children's schooling. She lives with her husband and their three children in the town of Kisauni. Elizabeth is a hard-working, unassuming, humble, and above all very responsible person with the desire to take her family's standard of living to another level. 
 
At the moment, Elizabeth has some some pending orders which need to be fulfilled soon, but she does not have the required materials. For this specific reason, she is requesting a loan in order to buy fabrics and to make needed repairs to her sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and to make needed repairs to her sewing machine

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet, age 45 and widowed, runs a hairdressing salon. She lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda with her two children, both of whom are enrolled in school. Janet has been working hard to manage her salon for the past 10 years. 

In order to expand her business, Janet has requested a loan in the amount of 2500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hair products, such as extensions. This will help Janet to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Janet hopes that in the future she will be able to be more productive and live a good life. 

Janet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Janet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more hair products for her salon

loans.name: Mabel Mireya

texts.es: Mabel vive en las orquídeas .Ella tiene 59 años. Ella es soltera tiene un hijo mayor de edad. Toma la decisión de buscar trabajo para seguir brindándole los estudios a su hijo  Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar .Ella decide  juntar dinero para dar apertura  a su negocio de venta  de mercadería general propio. En la actualidad su negocio poco a poco creció  hasta llegar a tener  una excelente  clientela  .Mabel trabaja en su negocio sola a las  6am hasta 11 pm. Con el préstamo comprara  víveres, papelería, varios etc. Su meta es poder  comprar materiales de construcción para poder continuar con el mejoramiento de su vivienda y obtener un mini Marquet
texts.en:
Mabel lives in Las Orquídeas. She is a 59-year-old, single woman with an adult son. She decided to look for work in order to continue supporting her son in his studies. Since she did not find any opportunity for work, she decided to open her own store. Her business has been growing, little by little, and now she has a good customer base. Mabel works alone in her store from 6 a.m. to 11 p.m. 

With this loan, she will buy groceries, paper products, and other general items. Her goal is to buy construction materials to continue improving her house, as well as to obtain a mini-market.

loans.use: to buy groceries and paper products.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel  vive en las orquídeas .Ella tiene 46 años. Ella es casada tiene dos  hijos menores  de edad. Ella Toma la decisión de buscar trabajo para seguir brindándole los estudios a sus hijos  Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar .Ella decide  juntar dinero para dar apertura  a su negocio de venta  de comida rápida  en general  En la actualidad su negocio poco a poco creció  hasta llegar a tener  una clientela  .Isabel trabaja en su negocio  diariamente. Con el préstamo comprara  cosméticos, materiales de cocina, telas, varios etc. Su meta es poder  seguir con los estudios de sus pequeños hijos y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Isabel lives in Las Orquídeas. She is 46 years old, married, and the mother of two young children. Isabel decided to look for work in order to continue to support her children's education. Since she was unable to find work, she decided to open her own business selling instant food products. Currently, her business has been growing steadily and now she has a steady customer base. She works daily in this business and plans to expand her merchandise with this loan.

Isabel plans to buy cosmetics, cooking materials, fabrics, and other products to sell. Her dream is that her children continue their studies, and that she will be able to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy fabric, cosmetics, and cooking materials.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 50 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom attend school.  She lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past two years, Ruth has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, soap, milk, and bread. 

Ruth is requesting a loan from BRAC Uganda for 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings, which she will use to buy more milk, bread, sugar, and soap to sell. The loan will help Ruth generate greater profits and boost her business. Ruth hopes that in the future she will be able to be more productive and maintain her business at that level. 

Ruth is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ruth who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase milk, bread, sugar, and soap to sell.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen, age 53, started a tailoring business many years ago to help her husband support the family. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf foundation; she took her first loan to buy a sewing machine. Her husband is employed in a small restaurant and his income is not sufficient to meet the family's daily expenditures, so Yasmeen is striving hard to help provide income for food, clothing, and health care for the family. 

She is very familiar with numerous stitching techniques and has built up a solid client list. Over the years, she has gained a great deal of appreciation and popularity among the members of her community. 

Yasmeen has requested a loan in the amount of Rs 30,000 in order to buy a stock of thread in different colors, buttons, needles, and zippers. As a result of making these purchases, she will be much better able to meet the demands of her customers. She is in her second loan cycle. 

Yasmeen hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good, high-quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to buy thread in different colors, buttons, needles, and zippers

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba sells second-hand dresses for women and children in her community of Batanya, near Cape Coast. She has been selling second-hand dresses for four years now. Araba is married and her husband is a trader. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their utility and accommodation bills. 

Araba needs this loan to purchase more second-hand women's and children's dresses to sell. With the new profit, Araba plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more second-hand women's and children's dresses to sell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama sells a variety of much-needed food items in Batanya, a town near Cape Coast. She sells gari (milled cassava dough), charcoal, and groundnut. She has been selling these products for about 15 years. 

Ama is a single parent with five children, and she uses her income to feed and clothe her children and to pay their school fees.  

Ama will use her loan to purchase bags of groundnut to sell, due to its current high demand among her customers. With the expected profit, she will expand and secure her growing business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of groundnut to sell

loans.name: Angela Sofia

texts.es:
Ángela Sofía tiene 49 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene 5 hijos,  vive con el esposo y los hijos en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LUCHA Y PROGRESO, sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura todos viven en el sector del recinto el Progreso Siembran maíz y arroz, Además fréjol Gandúl, y algunos crian Chanchos y pollos.

Ángela Sofía se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, además se dedica a la crianza de pollos, cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, líquido mata maleza, cerdos y pollos.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes que tanta falta le hace  para los cultivos.y los animales.

Las compras y las ventas lo hacen en Ventanas cada 15 días. El sueño es  sembarar 10 héctareas de cacao. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es luchar para salir adelante.
En el tiempo libre le gusta asistir a la iglesia.
texts.en:
Ángela Sofía is 49 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has five children. She lives with her husband and children in Ventanas which is in Los Ríos Province.

Ángela Sofía is a member of the Communal Bank “Lucha Y Progresso” (Struggle and Progress). Its members are all farmers who live in the neighborhood sector of El Progreso. They grow corn, rice, as well as pigeon peas. Some of the members raise pigs and chickens.

Ángela Sofía is a farmer who grows corn. She also raises chickens and pigs. Ángela is requesting a loan so that she can buy fertilizers that she lacks for her crops. She will also buy animals.

Her purchases and sales are conducted in Ventanas every 15 days. Her dream is to plant 10 hectares of cacao. The challenges she faces include having to struggle in order to move forward.

In her free time, Ángela Sofía enjoys attending church.

loans.use: to buy urea, liquid weed killer, pigs, and chickens.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica sells 'gari', a traditional dish made of milled cassava. Veronica lives in Bataya near Cape Coast and has prepared gari for sale for the past 15 years now.  She is married with eight children; her husband is a farmer. She uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their family. 

Veronica will use her loan to purchase bags of cassava for the preparation of gari to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business to meet the need of local students and large families who desire this filling dish.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cassava for the preparation of 'gari' (cassava couscous) to sell.

loans.name: Saba

texts.en:
Saba, age 32, started a business doing knitting work in her home about 10 years ago after her husband's business failed. She needed to generate income to support her family and to ensure a better future for them. She and her husband have three children, two of whom are enrolled in school. 

Saba knits for the people in her local community; however, due to the lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She is currently in her first loan cycle and has requested a loan in the amount of Rs 20,000 from Kashf. She intends to use her loan funds to buy raw material for her business, including bundles of wool, spools of thread in different colors, and packs of knitting needles. This will create a means of increasing revenues so that she may be able to consistently generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy raw material for her business, including bundles of wool, spools of thread in different colors, and packs of knitting needles

loans.name: Maqbool

texts.en: Ms Maqbool is a 53-year-old married woman and a dedicated mother of six children. She is efficiently doing a business in milk sales. She has 10 years of experience in this field. She has 3 buffalo and 2 cows. She also purchases small calves and sells them near the Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries like Pakistan). She earns a good profit from this business. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase another buffalo. She has been associated with Kashf Foundation for five years. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena lives with her husband and their 7 children in Batanya near Cape Coast. Her husband is a farmer. Abena is a fishmonger who buys fresh fish from the market and smokes them for sale. She has been in this business for 10 years. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. Abena wants to buy fish in larger quantities so she needs a loan from Kiva to help her purchase the amount of fish she wants and her customers demand. With the new profit she will expand her fish selling business.

loans.use: to help her purchase the amount of fish she wants and her customers demand.

loans.name: Cecilia Elizabeth

texts.es: Cecilia  vive en las Orquídeas. Tiene 48 años. Esta casada .tiene dos hijos menores de edad. Ella Toma la decisión de buscar trabajo para seguir con la educación de sus hijos y Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa. Ella decide juntar dinero  para dar apertura  a su negocio de costura en general  En la actualidad su negocio poco a poco creció  hasta llegar a tener  una clientela  Cecilia trabaja en su negocio solo  diariamente, ella se dirige a su trabajo a las 6 am de la mañana a dejar a sus hijos a la escuela. Con el préstamo comprara  tela, ropa, varios, etc. su meta es que sus hijos termine sus estudio tener ingreso para mejorar su negocio y su vivienda.
texts.en:
Cecilia lives in Las Orquídeas.  She is 48 years old, married, and has two minor children.  She made the decision to look for work in order for her children to continue their education.

As no one gave her the opportunity to work at a business, she decided to get together money in order to open her sewing business.

Her business has grown little by little, and she now has clientele.  Cecilia works alone in her business every day.  She heads to work at 6:00 a.m. after leaving her children at school.

She will use the loan to buy fabric, clothes, and various items.  Her goal is for her children to finish their education and to have income to improve her business and her house.

loans.use: to buy fabric and clothes.

loans.name: Zoilo Adalverto

texts.es:
El Señor Zoilo Adalverto es originario del municipio de El Sauce, toda su vida ha vivido en dicho municipio al lado de su familia, las cuales son personas honestas y trabajadoras que desde mucho tiempo se han dedicado al negocio de elaborar y vender tejas y ladrillos.

Es un negocio familiar heredado por su padre el cual siempre quiso que sus hijos se dedicaran a esta actividad y que la costumbre y tradición no se perdiera.

Este material lo elabora en conjunto con cuatro hijos para luego ser vendido a los pobladores de dicho municipio para la construcción de viviendas.

 La teja y el ladrillo lo elaboran a base de barro, la teja generalmente en nuestro municipio la ocupan para techo y el ladrillo para construir las paredes.

Desde que inició su negocio se ha esforzado por elaborar y vender este tipo de material de buena calidad para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

Actualmente está solicitando un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de leña y pago de mano de obra con el objetivo de producir más este tipo de material y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sr. Zoilo Adalverto is originally from the town of El Sauce. He has lived there his entire life alongside his family. The members of his family are honest and hardworking people who spend a great deal of time managing a business that produces and sells tiles and bricks.

Zoilo manages the family business that he inherited from his father, who always wanted his children to pursue this line of work since it is a custom and tradition that should not be lost. Zoilo and his four children work together in making their products, which are later sold to the residents of their town so that they can build houses.

Tiles and bricks are made of clay. Tiles are generally used for the roof and the bricks are used to construct the walls. From the start of this business, Zoilo has strived to produce and sell construction materials that are of good quality so that he can satisfy the demands of his customers.

He is currently requesting a loan from CEPRODEL so that he can buy firewood and pay for labor. His goal is to produce more construction materials so that he can meet the demands of his customers.

loans.use: to buy firewood and pay for labor.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana sells well-made secondhand dresses for ladies and children; she has been selling secondhand dresses for four years now. Diana is married; her husband is a trader. She uses her income to assist her husband with their utility and accommodation bills. Diana needs this loan to purchase more secondhand ladies' and children's dresses to sell. With the new profit Diana plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand ladies' and children's dresses to sell.

loans.name: Mwanapili

texts.en:
The motivation to remain in business is still in Mwanapili's mind. She is a dedicated woman who has been selling cassava for some time. Thanks to the experience and the service she delivers, she has been able to establish a good clientele base. Mwanapili narrates that since her previous loan, her business has been flourishing little by little and she can count on good results. 

She is currently asking for a new loan to expand her existing business. She plans to buy sacks of cassava to sell. She is grateful for the support she is offered by Kiva and Yehu.

loans.use: to buy sacks of cassava to sell.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa  is a petty trader who sells maize, provisions and soft drinks. In front of her is the maize she sells; she is getting it ready for the market. Adwoa has been in this business for four years now.  She is married with six children and her husband works with the  Ghana coco board. She uses her income to assist her husband for the upkeep of their children. 

Adwoa will use her loan to purchase bags of maize, provisions and soft drinks to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize, provisions, and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Lisette Margot

texts.es: Lisette vive en el cantón playas .Ella tiene 24 años. Ella es soltera. Toma la decisión de buscar trabajo para terminar sus estudios  Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar .Ella decide  juntar dinero que tenia  y dar apertura  a su negocio de venta  de mercadería general. En la actualidad su negocio poco a poco creció  hasta llegar a tener  una excelente  clientela  y ahora posee de  bazar .Lisette  trabaja en su negocio a las  6 :30 am .Ella realiza pedidos cada quince días Con el préstamo comprara  joyas , bisutería , varios etc. Su meta es poder  comprar materiales de construcción para poder continuar con el mejoramiento de su vivienda
texts.en: Lisette lives in Cantón Playas. She is 24 years old and single. After no one gave her a chance to work so she could complete her studies; She decided to gather some money she had to start her own business, opening a store to sell general merchandise. Today her bazaar enjoys an excellent customer base that grew gradually. Lisette works on her business starting at 6:30 am. She places orders for merchandise every other week. With the loan she will buy jewelry, custom jewelry, various items, etc. Her goal is to purchase building materials in order to continue improving her home.

loans.use: purchase jewelry, custom jewelry, various items

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Issa is 57 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Issa has been working hard to manage his small business, which does welding . 

To help expand his business, Issa has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more metal that will be used for making beds, doors and windows, and will help Issa to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children and have a better life. Issa hopes that in the future he will be able to own a very big business. 

Issa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Issa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: to buy more metal that will be used for making beds, doors and windows.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a food vender who cooks banku (a corn/cassava dough) to sale. Ama serves her dish with okro meat and fish stew to create a complete and favorite meal for her customers. Ama has prepared banku meal for sale for the past 10 year in the town of Batanya near Cape Coast. She lives with her husband and 6 children. Her husband is a farmer in the area. Ama uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees and for the general bills of her family. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and fish for the preparation of her banku meal for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to create a place where her customers can come together and eat.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish for the preparation of her banku (a corn/cassava dough) meal for sale.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba sells kenkey (a corn dough, often wrapped in a corn husk) in Batanya near Cape Coast. In the picture above Aba is showing part of the kenkey preparation process; the corn is first washed and soaked, then milled into dough and molded into balls. It is then wrapped in the corn husk and cooked.

Aba has been preparing kenkey in this way for the past 10 years. Aba has 6 children and uses her income to take care of the children and pay for the family's accommodation and utility bills.  Aba will use the loan to purchase more corn to prepare kenkey to sell. With the new profits from her business, Aba will expand her kenkey selling business.

loans.use: to purchase more corn to prepare kenkey (a corn dough, often wrapped in a corn husk) to sell.

loans.name: Terezia

texts.en:
Terezia is 61 years old and married to Nehemia. Both of them are engaged in business. Terezia owns rental houses, a sand quarry, and a boutique. She has been in these businesses for the past 39 years, and now she earns an income of KES 25,000 per month.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, in the amount of KES 100,000, which she plans to use to rent a quarry and add employees. She will use the extra profit to rent a quarry.

She hopes to open a ballast (stone crushing) business, one day.

loans.use: To rent a quarry and add more employees.

loans.name: Hugo Francisco

texts.es:
Hugo Francisco tiene 52 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene 5 hijos , vive con la esposa y con los hijos en Ventanas en la Provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la VRC LUCHA Y PROGRESO, sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura todos viven en el sector del recinto el Progreso siembran maíz y arroz, además fréjol gandúl y algunos crian chanchos y pollos.

Hugo Francisco se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, abonos, insecticidas, ranger, líquido mata maleza.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes que le hace falta para los cultivos.
Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Ventanas. El sueño es poder sembrar cacao. Los desafíos al que se enfrenta son las plagas, el mal clima. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
